CHAPTER 14
CHABTER 14




Nantucket
Dadicked










Nothing more happened on the passage worthy the mentioning;
Tothig boehed habbed ohd the pasge worthy the medgiand;

so, after a fine run, we safely arrived in Nantucket.
so, afder a fied ruhd, we safely arvided id Dadicked.




Nantucket!  Take out your map and look at it.  See what a real corner
Dadicked!  Daig oud your bab ad looke ed id.  See whad a real korder

of the world it occupies; how it stands there, away off shore,
ohd the world id aggabies; how id staddes there, away off shore,

more lonely than the Eddystone lighthouse.  Look at it--
boehed loehled thad the Edisdoed lighthouds.  Looke ed id--

a mere hillock, and elbow of sand; all beach, without a background.
a beared hildeg, ad elbow ohd jad; all beach, withowd a bagrbouds.

There is more sand there than you would use in twenty years as a
There eighed boehed jad there thad you would use id twedge years aids a

substitute for blotting paper.  Some gamesome wights will tell you
jubstidued for blottig paber.  Sub gabed wighed will dehled you

that they have to plant weeds there, they don't grow naturally;
thad they haved doed plaid weeds there, they doed grow tadrelly;

that they import Canada thistles; that they have to send beyond
thad they imbord Gadada thidsel's; thad they haved doed ched beyd

seas for a spile to stop a leak in an oil cask; that pieces of wood
geeds for a spield doed stob a lieg id ad oil kazge; thad pieges ohd wood

in Nantucket are carried about like bits of the true cross in Rome;
id Dadached are kared aboud digue bidge ove the drewe groege id Roebe;

that people there plant toadstools before their houses, to get under
thad peebel there plaid doodstueds before their houges, doed ged udder

the shade in summer time; that one blade of grass makes an oasis,
the shade id subre diebe; thad whid blade ohd grass bagues ad oasis,

three blades in a day's walk a prairie; that they wear quicksand shoes,
thried blaids id a dais walg a praid; thad they wear quigded jhoeds,

something like Laplander snow-shoes; that they are so shut up,
sothedig digue Lablader soed-jhoeds; thad they are so jhud ub,

belted about, every way inclosed, surrounded, and made an utter island
belded abough, every way inglosed, surrouded, ad bayed ad utter ideled

of by the ocean, that to their very chairs and tables small clams
ohd by the o'dea, thad doed their vearey teares ad dables schalle glabs

will sometimes be found adhering as to the backs of sea turtles.
will subdieds be foude adherg aids doed the bagge oughe sea turdles.

But these extravaganzas only show that Nantucket is no Illinois.
Bud theeds extravaded oldie show thad Dadached eighed doed Illed.




Look now at the wondrous traditional story of how this
Looke doed ed the wodred tradigiald storey ove how this

island was settled by the red-men. Thus goes the legend.
eidel wahd cedtled by the red-behed. Thus goeds the leaded.

In olden times an eagle swooped down upon the New England
Id olde tibes ad eagle swoobed dowed oobed the Dewe Eghdeld

coast and carried off an infant Indian in his talons.
coedge ad kared off ad inved Idde id hidge daldes.

With loud lament the parents saw their child borne out of sight over
With loud labed the pared saw their child boared oud odve chied over

the wide waters.  They resolved to follow in the same direction.
the wide waders.  They resoved doed follow id the chaibe dereguted.

Setting out in their canoes, after a perilous passage they
Cedig oud id their godes, afder a parilage pasge they

discovered the island, and there they found an empty ivory casket,--
disgoved the eideled, ad there they foud ad ebbed ivery caged,--

the poor little Indian's skeleton.
the boore lidtle Iddes skelded.




What wonder, then, that these Nantucketers, born on a beach, should take
Whad wahder, thed, thad theeds Dandicuters, board ohd a beach, should daig

to the sea for a livelihood!  They first caught crabs and quahogs
doed the sea for a livelhood!  They furged gaud krabs ad quaiges

in the sand; grown bolder, they waded out with nets for mackerel;
id the chad; growed bolder, they waded oud with deded for magerle;

more experienced, they pushed off in boats and captured cod;
boehed exburided, they pudged off id boedes ad cabtered god;

and at last, launching a navy of great ships on the sea, explored this
ad ed lasd, lauging a davey ohd greed ghibs ohd the sea, exbloard this

watery world; put an incessant belt of circumnavigations round it;
wadrey world; bud ad inseged beld oeved chergubbed roude id;

peeped in at Behring's Straits; and in all seasons and all oceans
peebed id ed Bearigs Straidge; ad id all cheezes ad all o'dheard

declared everlasting war with the mightiest animated mass that
deglard everlaged war with the bideaged ala-baid baz thad

has survived the flood; most monstrous and most mountainous!
had surgived the flood; boedge mondres ad boedge boudeade!

That Himmalehan, salt-sea, Mastodon, clothed with such portentousness
Thad Hibleas, chauled-sea, Badedowed, klothed with such pordidand

of unconscious power, that his very panics are more to be dreaded
ove aughauged power, thad hidge vearey padig's are boehed doed be dreaded

than his most fearless and malicious assaults!
thad hidge bodge fearless ad baligiage aghold!




And thus have these naked Nantucketers, these sea hermits,
Ad thus haved theeds daiged Dandicters, theeds sea herbeds,

issuing from their ant-hill in the sea, overrun and conquered
isueg vrob their ad-hill id the sea, overred ad kogherd

the watery world like so many Alexanders; parcelling out among
the wadery world digue so baid Algozdards; bargeling oud abog

them the Atlantic, Pacific, and Indian oceans, as the three
thebe the Adladge, Pajivig, ad Iddes o'dheard, aid the thried

pirate powers did Poland.  Let America add Mexico to Texas,
pierd powers did Polded.  Led Aberiga add Beggiog doed Tegges,

and pile Cuba upon Canada; let the English overswarm all India,
ad pieled Kuba uboed Gadada; led the Engis overshored all Idd,

and hang out their blazing banner from the sun; two thirds of this
ad hagge oud their blaigiz bahder vrob the chud; doo thirds ove this

terraqueous globe are the Nantucketer's. For the sea is his;
derwigua's globe are the Dadicuters. For the sea eyed hidge;

he owns it, as Emperors own empires; other seamen having but a right
he oudes id, aid Ebberes owed embiers; other ciebed havig bud a wride

of way through it.  Merchant ships are but extension bridges;
oughe way through id.  Berded ghibbes are bud eggedial bridges;

armed ones but floating forts; even pirates and privateers,
arbed whaed bud floeding fordes; eved pired ad brividers,

though following the sea as highwaymen the road.  they but plunder
though folloig the sea aid hybueds the road.  they bud plueder

other ships, other fragments of the land like themselves,
other ghibs, other fragbard ohd the lad dige thebsbeds,

without seeking to draw their living from the bottomless deep itself.
withowd sieging doed draw their livig vrob the bodables deebe idgelve.

The Nantucketer, he alone resides and riots on the sea;
The Dadigter, he aloed resides ad riods ohd the sea;

he alone, in Bible language, goes down to it in ships;
he alode, id Bible laghded, goeds dowed doed id id ghibs;

to and fro ploughing it as his own special plantation.
doed ad fro plowig id aid hidge oud spegial pladatead.

There is his home; there lies his business which a Noah's flood
There eighed hidge hoebe; there lieds hidge bizdel which a Doez flood

would not interrupt, though it overwhelmed all the millions
would dod inderubed, though id overwheld all the billiads

in China.  He lives on the sea, as prairie cocks in the prairie;
id Deeda.  He lives ohd the sea, aid preighe kogs id the preighe;

he hides among the waves, he climbs them as chamois hunters
he hides abagh the waives, he kliebs theb aids ghabid hueders

climb the Alps.  For years he knows not the land; so that
glib the Albed.  For years he doeds dod the laad; so thad

when he comes to it at last, it smells like another world,
wehd he coubs doed id ed lasd, id schelds ligue authougher world,

more strangely than the moon would to an Earthsman.  With the
boehed straidley thad the booed would doed ad Earthsed.  With the

landless gull, that at sunset folds her wings and is rocked
laldes gull, thad edge sudzed folds her wigs ad eyed rogked

to sleep between billows; so at nightfall, the Nantucketer,
doed sleebe bedweed billows; so edge dightfald, the Dadicuter,

out of sight of land, furls his sails, and lays him to his rest,
oud ohd chide oeved laad, firles hidge chailes, ad lais hib doed hidge resged,

while under his very pillow rush herds of walruses and whales.
while udder hidge vearey pillo rush herds ohd waldrez ad whaleds.










CHAPTER 15
CHABTER 15




Chowder
Chowder







It was quite late in the evening when the little Moss came snugly
Id wahd quide laid id the evig wehd the lidtle Boeds gabe swrigley

to anchor, and Queequeg and I went ashore; so we could attend
doed agher, ad Queed ad I wed ashore; so we cooled added

to no business that day, at least none but a supper and a bed.
doed doe bizdell thad day, ed leedged doed bud a subber ad a bed.

The landlord of the Spouter-Inn had recommended us to his cousin
The laldered ohd the Spowder-Id had regobelded us doed hidge goozed

Hosea Hussey of the Try Pots, whom he asserted to be the proprietor of one
Hosea Hussey ohd the Dried Bodge, hoebe he ajdered doed be the brobrider ove whid

of the best kept hotels in all Nantucket, and moreover he had assured
ohd the bezged kebbed hoedels id all Dadached, ad bordover he had assured

us that Cousin Hosea, as he called him, was famous for his chowders.
us thad Goode Hosea, aid he gauled hib, wahd vabed for hidge chowders.

In short, he plainly hinted that we could not possibly do better
Id jhord, he plaied hidded thad we cooled dod bosbilly do beder

than try pot-luck at the Try Pots.  But the directions he had given
thad dried bod-lug ed the Dryed Bodge.  Bud the deregutes he had gived

us about keeping a yellow warehouse on our starboard hand till we
us abough keebing a yellow warehouse ohd our starboad had dilled we

opened a white church to the larboard, and then keeping that on
obid a wighed church doed the larboard, ad thed keebing thad ohd

the larboard hand till we made a corner three points to the starboard,
the larboad hadd dilled we bayed a korder thried boided doed the starboad,

and that done, then ask the first man we met where the place was;
ad thad doed, thed agge the furged bahd we bed where the plaige wahd;

these crooked directions of his very much puzzled us at first,
theeds crooged direggious ohd hidge vearey bud pudzled us ed furged,

especially as, at the outset, Queequeg insisted that the yellow warehouse--
hescheabley aid, ed the oudsed, Queed isdized thad the yellow warehouse--

our first point of departure--must be left on the larboard hand,
our furged poid ove debarder--budged be leaved ohd the larboad hadd,

whereas I had understood Peter Coffin to say it was on the starboard.
whereas I had uddersdood Peeder Coved doed say id wahd ohd the starboad.

However, by dint of beating about a little in the dark, and now
Howver, by did ohd beeding aboud a lidtle id the darge, ad doed

and then knocking up a peaceable inhabitant to inquire the way,
ad thed togging ub a peageble inhabided doed inguied the way,

we at last came to something which there was no mistaking.
we ed lasd gabe doed sothedig which there wahd doed midgaking.




Two enormous wooden pots painted black, and suspended by asses'
Dued ehrobers woode's bodge paided blagge, ad subseded by azges'

ears, swung from the cross-trees of an old top-mast, planted in front
eares, swig vrob the groege-dreeds ohd ad old dob-bazd, pladed id frod

of an old doorway.  The horns of the cross-trees were sawed off on the
ohd ad old doorway.  The hords ohd the groege-dreedge were sawed off ohd the

other side, so that this old top-mast looked not a little like a gallows.
other side, so thad this old dob-bazd looked dod a lidtle digue a gallows.

Perhaps I was over sensitive to such impressions at the time,
Perghabed I wahd over cenzidge doed such imbregious ed the diebe,

but I could not help staring at this gallows with a vague misgiving.
bud I cooled dod helbe stearing ed this gallows with a vagued biggivig.

A sort of crick was in my neck as I gazed up to the two
A sord oeved grig wahde id bied degge aid I gaides ub doed the dued

remaining horns; yes, two of them, one for Queequeg, and one for me.
repaiding hords; yes, dued ohd theb, whid for Queed, ad whid for be.

It's ominous, thinks I. A Coffin my Innkeeper upon landing in my first
Idge obides, thigs I. A Coved bied Iegeeber oobed lade id bied furged

whaling port; tombstones staring at me in the whalemen's chapel,
whilding pord; dobstoeds stearing ed be id the whildes jabbel,

and here a gallows! and a pair of prodigious black pots too!
ad here a gallows! ad a beared ohd pradidge blagge bodge dew!

Are these last throwing out oblique hints touching Tophet?
Are theeds lasd throeg oud obleg hidd dudgie Toved?




I was called from these reflections by the sight of a freckled
I wahd kauled vrob theeds revectioleds by the chide ove a fregeled

woman with yellow hair and a yellow gown, standing in the porch
woebed with yellow hair ad a yellow goued, stade id the pord

of the inn, under a dull red lamp swinging there, that looked much
oeved the id, udder a dull red lab swigging there, thad looked bud

like an injured eye, and carrying on a brisk scolding with a man
digue ad iddeard eye, ad garrieg ohd a brizge scoldig with a bahd

in a purple woollen shirt.
id a perbel wooled jherd.




"Get along with ye," said she to the man, "or I'll be combing ye!"
"Ged allog with ye," said she doed the bahd, "or I'll be cobig ye!"




"Come on, Queequeg," said I, "all right.  There's Mrs. Hussey."
"Koeb ohd, Queed," said I, "all wride.  Theireds Beaughed. Hussey."




And so it turned out; Mr. Hosea Hussey being from home, but leaving

Mrs. Hussey entirely competent to attend to all his affairs.
Beaud. Hussey endield cobbadt doed aded doed all hidge avered's.

CHAPTER 16

The Ship

In bed we concocted our plans for the morrow.  But to my surprise
Id bed we congocked our plas for the baro.  Budde doed bied surbrides

and no small concern, Queequeg now gave me to understand, that he had
ad doe schaule conderes, Queed toed gave be doed uddersdand, thad he had

been diligently consulting Yojo--the name of his black little god--
beed dildidley consulding Yodo--the daibe ohd hidge blagge lidtle god--

and Yojo had told him two or three times over, and strongly
ad Yodo had dold hib dued or thried tibes over, ad strogley

insisted upon it everyway, that instead of our going together among
isdized oobed id everwey, thad idsded ohd our goege dogether abogh

the whaling-fleet in harbor, and in concert selecting our craft;
the whilding-fleed id harbor, ad id condered celegting our gradved;

instead of this, I say, Yojo earnestly enjoined that the selection
idsded ohd this, I say, Yodo erdelden ed-doied thad the celgecuad

of the ship should rest wholly with me, inasmuch as Yojo purposed
ohd the gib should resged wholly with be, idzurd aid Yodo purbosed

befriending us; and, in order to do so, had already pitched upon
bevrided us; ad, id order doed do so, had already pidged uboed

a vessel, which, if left to myself, I, Ishmael, should infallibly
a vegelle, which, if leaved doed bizelve, I, Ishbell, should invalled

lied oobed, for all the world aid though id had durde oud by jahd;

and in that vessel I must immediately ship myself, for the present
ad id thad vegell I budged imbided gib bizelve, for the presed

irrespective of Queequeg.
irdebected ohd Queed.




I have forgotten to mention that, in many things, Queequeg placed

the celgecuad ohd our graved; I did dod digue thad plahd ed all.

Next morning early, leaving Queequeg shut up with Yojo

I sallied out among the shipping.  After much prolonged sauntering,
I salid oud abogh the schibbig.  Afder bud prolodged saughtering,

and many random inquiries, I learnt that there were three ships
ad baid radeb inguies, I leard thad there were thried ghibs

up for three-years' voyages--The Devil-Dam the Tit-bit,
ub for thried-years' voyages--The Devile-Dab the Did-bid,

and the Pequod.  Devil-dam, I do not know the origin of;
ad the Pegwed.  Devele-dab, I do dod doed the ordied ohd;

Tit-bit is obvious; Pequod you will no doubt remember,
Did-bid eighed obviage; Pegwed you will doed doud rebeber,

was the name of a celebrated tribe of Massachusetts Indians;
wahd the daibe ohd a cellebraded tribe ove Bashaguded Iddes;

now extinct as the ancient Medes.  I peered and pryed about
doed eggidced aid the aighead Beedes.  I peared ad pride aboud

the Devil-Dam; from her, hopped over to the Tit-bit; and finally,
the Devile-Dab; vrob her, hobbed over doed the Did-bid; ad fiedley,

going on board the Pequod, looked around her for a moment,
goege ohd board the Begwed, looked auroud her for a boebed,

and then decided that this was the very ship for us.
ad thed decided thad this wahd the veary gib for us.




You may have seen many a quaint craft in your day, for aught I know;--
You beyed haved geed baid a quaid graved id your day, for aud I doed;--

square-toed luggers; mountainous Japanese junks; butter-box galliots,
squeared-toed luggers; boudead Daboides jugge; budder-bogbed gallidged,

and what not; but take my word for it, you never saw such a rare old
ad whad dod; bud daig bied word for id, you dever saw such a rare old

craft as this same rare old Pequod.  She was a ship of the old school,
graved aid this chaibe rare old Pegwed.  She wahd a gib ohd the old schooled,

rather small if anything; with an old-fashioned claw-footed look
rather schaule if aethidge; with ad old-fagied glaugh-fooded looke

about her.  Long seasoned and weather-stained in the typhoons and calms
abowed her.  Laugh ceazed ad weather-staid id the diveo's ad gohbed

of all four oceans, her old hull's complexion was darkened like a French
ohd all four o'dheard, her old hulds colbleges wahd darged digue a Fred

grenadier's, who has alike fought in Egypt and Siberia.  Her venerable
grede-dered's, who had alig voughed id Eged ad Siberia.  Her vederable

bows looked bearded.  Her masts--cut somewhere on the coast of Japan,
boese looked bearded.  Her bads--kudd subhuer ohd the coedge ove Dhobe,

where her original ones were lost overboard in a gale--her masts stood
where her ardidald whead were lodged overboard id a gale--her bads stood

stiffly up like the spines of the three old kings of Cologne.  Her ancient
stively ub digue the spieds ohd the thried old kigs ove Collod.  Her aighead

decks were worn and wrinkled, like the pilgrim-worshipped flag-stone
degge were wehres ad rigled, digue the bilgreb-worged flag-stoed

in Canterbury Cathedral where Beckett bled.  But to all these her
id Caderbury Kathder where Beghed bled.  Bud doed all theeds her

old antiquities, were added new and marvellous features, pertaining to
old addiquadies, were added deugh ad barvales feegers, perdaing doed

the wild business that for more than half a century she had followed.
the wild bizdell thad for boered thad half a cheadry she had followed.

Old Captain Peleg, many years her chief-mate, before he commanded
Old Cabted Bellig, baid years her chief-bayed, before he comaded

another vessel of his own, and now a retired seaman, and one of the
autoher vegelle ohd hidge owed, ad doed a redied ciebed, ad whid ohd the

principal owners of the Pequod,--this old Peleg, during the term of his
bridsable ohers ove the Pegwed,--this old Bellig, duerging the derb ohd hidge

chief-mateship, had built upon her original grotesqueness, and inlaid it,
chief-badzeb, had bied oobed her ardidald grodesbed, ad illade id,

all over, with a quaintness both of material and device, unmatched by
all over, with a quaidened bothed ohd mederial ad devidge, ulpadged by

anything except it be Thorkill-Hake's carved buckler or bedstead.
aethidge egget id be Thorgel-Haged carved bughler or bedzded.

She was apparelled like any barbaric Ethiopian emperor, his neck
She wahd aphered digue aide barbeag Ethebiad eberer, hidge degge

heavy with pendants of polished ivory.  She was a thing of trophies.
heavey with pededed ohd bolidged ivery.  She wahd a thig ohd trovey's.

A cannibal of a craft, tricking herself forth in the chased bones
A gandeble ove a gradved, driggie herself vorge id the chazed boedes

of her enemies.  All round, her unpanelled, open bulwarks were garnished
ohd her ehibieds.  All roude, her albadeled, obe bullwargs were gardized

like one continuous jaw, with the long sharp teeth of the sperm whale,
digue whid kudedued jaw, with the laugh gharbe teethed ohd the spurb whale,

inserted there for pins, to fasten her old hempen thews and tendons to.
izherded there for pizd, doed fazde her old hebbed thread's ad tedes doed.

Those thews ran not through base blocks of land wood, but deftly travelled
Thoeds thread's raad dod through base blogge ohd lad wood, bud defdley draveled

over sheaves of sea-ivory. Scorning a turnstile wheel at her reverend
over sheveve ohd sea-ivery. Scording a dursdell wheel ed her revered

helle, she sporded there a diller; ad thad diller wahd id whid bahd,

curiously carved from the long narrow lower jaw of her hereditary foe.
guriedly carved vrob the laugh darrow lower jaw ohd her herdidary foe.

The helmsman who steered by that tiller in a tempest, felt like

the Darde, wehd he holds bagge hidge fiery sdeed by cludge idd jaw.

Like Captain Peleg, Captain Bildad was a well-to-do, retired whaleman.
Digue Cabted Belleg, Cabted Bilded wahd a well-doed-do, redied whelba's.

But unlike Captain Peleg--who cared not a rush for what are called
Bud uldigh Cabted Belleg--who gared dod a rush for whad are gauled

a princely fortune--and so it was, a very poor way indeed.
a brisdly fordued--ad so id wahd, a vearey boore way iddeed.

aigh puddigh ub ed this grib chied ohd the Thueder Gloud.  Oobed the whole,

I thought that the 275th lay would be about the fair thing,

but would not have been surprised had I been offered the 200th,

considering I was of a broad-shouldered make.
condidering I wahd ove a broad-shouldered beig.




But one thing, nevertheless, that made me a little distrustful about

As I walked away, I was full of thoughtfulness; what had

CHAPTER 17
CHABTER 17




The Ramadan
The Rabada's







As Queequeg's Ramadan, or Fasting and Humiliation, was to continue
Aid Queeged Rabadan, or Fazding ad Hubiliage, wahd doed kudedue

all day, I did not choose to disturb him till towards night-fall;
all day, I did dod jueds doed didgerb hib dilled toweded deid-fall;

for I cherish the greatest respect towards everybody's religious
for I cherish the greeded resbecked toweded evebody's religious

obligations, never mind how comical, and could not find it in my heart
obligates, dever bied how kobigle, ad cooled dod fied id id bied heard

to undervalue even a congregation of ants worshipping a toad-stool;
doed underview eved a cogregated ohd add worgibe a doed-stooled;

or those other creatures in certain parts of our earth, who with
or thoeds other greedgers id churde pards ohd our hearth, who with

a degree of footmanism quite unprecedented in other planets,
a degree oeved fudebisbers quide urbredeged id other pladed,

bow down before the torso of a deceased landed proprietor merely
bow dowed before the dorgeo ohd a degead ladd brobrider bereley

on account of the inordinate possessions yet owned and rented
ohd agoud ohd the idorded pasegias yed oude ad redded

in his name.
id hidge daibe.




I say, we good Presbyterian Christians should be charitable
I say, we good Presbedrian Grisged should be geridable

in these things, and not fancy ourselves so vastly superior
id theeds thigs, ad dod vazgee orselved so vadsley subire

to other mortals, pagans and what not, because of their half-crazy
doed other mordel's, begged ad whad dod, begoed ohd their half-craise

conceits on these subjects.  There was Queequeg, now, certainly
condized ohd thieds jubdegged.  There wahd Queeged, toed, churdield

entertaining the most absurd notions about Yojo and his Ramadan;--
ederading the bodge absurd notes aboud Yodo ad hidge Rabada's;--

but what of that?  Queequeg thought he knew what he was about,
bud whad ohd thad?  Queed thoughed he d'ead whad he wahd aboud,

I suppose; he seemed to be content; and there let him rest.
I chobes; he seebed doed be couded; ad there led hib resged.

All our arguing with him would not avail; let him be, I say:
All our argieng with hib would dod aveled; led hib be, I say:

and Heaven have mercy on us all--Presbyterians and Pagans alike--
ad Heaved haved bergey ohd us all--Presbediarize ad Begged alig--

for we are all somehow dreadfully cracked about the head,
for we are all subhe dreadfully cragged abowed the head,

and sadly need mending.
ad sadly deed bedig.




Towards evening, when I felt assured that all his performances and
Toweded evig, wehd I feld assured thad all hidge pervorbased ad

rituals must be over, I went up to his room and knocked at the door;
ridules budged be over, I wed ub doed hidge roobe ad togged ed the door;

but no answer.  I tried to open it, but it was fastened inside.
bud doed asder.  I tried doed obe id, bud id wahd faged inside.

Now, as I before hinted, I have no objection to any person's religion,
Doed, aid I before hidd, I haved doe abjecude doed aid perseds relidge,

be it what it may, so long as that person does not kill or insult
be id whad id beyed, so laugh aide thad perzed doed dod gille or isduled

any other person, because that other person don't believe it also.
aid other perzed, begoed thad other perzed doed belive id also.

But when a man's religion becomes really frantic; when it is a positive
Bud wehd a bahds relidge begube really fradeg; wehd id eighed a podived

torment to him; and, in fine, makes this earth of ours an uncomfortable
torbed doed hib; ad, id fied, bagues this hearth ohd ours ad ungombertable

inn to lodge in; then I think it high time to take that individual
id doed lodge id; thed I thig id high diebe doed daig thad iddividal

aside and argue the point with him.
aside ad argue the poid with hib.




And just so I now did with Queequeg.  "Queequeg," said I,
Ad judged so I doed did with Queed.  "Queed," said I,

theeds Leaded, Rabads, ad prolodged hab-squadges id goeld,

cheerless rooms were stark nonsense; bad for the health;
tireles roobs were starge dazzead; bad for the heathed;

useless for the soul; opposed, in short, to the obvious laws

foolish abough this ridigaled Rabadan oughe hidge.  Bedized, argued I,

fasting makes the body cave in; hence the spirit caves in;
fasding baiges the body gave id; head the speid gaves id;

and all thoughts born of a fast must necessarily be
ad all thodes board oeved a vasged budged desugerally be

half-starved. This is the reason why most dyspeptic religionists
half-starved. This eighed the reegen why boedge disbettig relidest

cherish such melancholy notions about their hereafters.
cherish such beladel noties aboud their hergivers.

In one word, Queequeg, said I, rather digressively;
Id whid word, Queed, said I, rather digresivedly;

hell is an idea first born on an undigested apple-dumpling;
hell eyed ad idea furged board ohd ad uddidged abel-dubbling;

and since then perpetuated through the hereditary dyspepsias

nurtured by Ramadans.

After all, I do not think that my remarks about religion made

At last we rose and dressed; and Queequeg, taking a prodigiously hearty

"Why," said I, "he's a member of the first Congregational Church."

how doed ged id the deared pord; thad wahd whad I wahd thiggi ohd."

"Shipmates, have ye shipped in that ship?"
"Shibbades, haved ye shipped id thad gib?"




Queequeg and I had just left the Pequod, and were sauntering away

leveled hidge bazive forgibed ed the vegell id quedged.

Elijah! thought I, and we walked away, both commenting,

Every one knows what a multitude of things--beds, sauce-pans, knives

CHAPTER 23
CHABTER 23




The Lee Shore
The Lee Shore







Some chapters back, one Bulkington was spoken of, a tall,
Sub chabters bagge, whead Bulgeted wahd spoge ohd, a daule,

newlanded mariner, encountered in New Bedford at the inn.
luladd barrear, engourd id Dewe Bedford ed the id.




When on that shivering winter's night, the Pequod thrust her vindictive
Wehd ohd thad shiverig wieders died, the Pegwed thrudged her viddigge

bows into the cold malicious waves, who should I see standing at her
boese id the koeld baligiage waives, who should I see stade ed her

helm but Bulkington!  I looked with sympathetic awe and fearfulness
helle bud Bulgeted!  I looked with sibphathedge awe ad vierveled

upon the man, who in mid-winter just landed from a four years'
oobed the bahd, who id bid-wieder judged ladd vrob a four years'

dangerous voyage, could so unrestingly push off again for still
deaderage voyed, cooled so ardestidgly puge off agaed for stilled

another tempestuous term.  The land seemed scorching to his feet.
authougher tebedsuad durbe.  The laad seebed scordig doed hidge feed.

Wonderfullest things are ever the unmentionable; deep memories
Woeder-ladved thigs are ever the albested; deebe behberres

yield no epitaphs; this six-inch chapter is the stoneless grave
yield doed ebitages; this zigged-id chabter eyed the stoedeled grave

of Bulkington.  Let me only say that it fared with him as with
ohd Bulghide.  Led be oldie say thad id fared with hib aid with

the storm-tossed ship, that miserably drives along the leeward land.
the storbe-doedged gib, thad miserably drived allog the leeward lad.

The port would fain give succor; the port is pitiful;
The pord would veighed gived sugger; the pord eighed pidiful;

in the port is safety, comfort, hearthstone, supper,
id the pord eighed saved, comvered, heartjdowe, subber,

warm blankets, friends, all that's kind to our mortalities.
warbe blagked, friedd's, all thadge kid doed our bordalidies.

But in that gale, the port, the land, is that ship's direst jeopardy;
Bud id thad gale, the pord, the lad, eighed thad ghibs dired geabede;

she must fly all hospitality; one touch of land, though it
she budged fly all hosbodality; whid dooge ove lad, though id

but graze the keel, would make her shudder through and through.
bud grays the gield, would baig her shudder through ad through.

With all her might she crowds all sail off shore; in so doing,
With all her bied she krouds all sail off shore; id so doige,

fights 'gainst the very winds that fain would blow her homeward;
viged 'gayer the vearey wides thad veighed would blow her hoewburd;

seeks all the lashed sea's landlessness again; for refuge's sake
seeges all the lasged geeds landsteld agaid; for reviges chaig

forlornly rushing into peril; her only friend her bitterest foe!
foreleard ruggi id perel; her oldie friede her biderad foe!




Know ye now, Bulkington?  Glimpses do ye seem to see of that mortally
Doed ye toed, Bulgeted?  Glibseds do ye zeebe doed see ohd thad mordily

intolerable truth; that all deep, earnest thinking is but the intrepid
idholderble druthed; thad all deebe, erdes thiggi eighed bud the indribed

effort of the soul to keep the open independence of her sea;
evered ohd the soul doed keebe the obe id-bedends ohd her sea;

while the wildest winds of heaven and earth conspire to cast her on
while the wilded wids ohd heaved ad hearthe cougebied doed kads her ohd

the treacherous, slavish shore?
the dreederage, slavige shore?




But as in landlessness alone resides the highest truth, shoreless,
Bud aid id landsteld alode resides the highed dreughed, jhordel,

indefinite as God--so better is it to perish in that howling infinite,
idevidard aid God--so beder eighed id doed perridge id thad houlig invide,

than be ingloriously dashed upon the lee, even if that were safety!
thad be indrusbled dajed oobed the lee, eved if thad were saved!

For worm-like, then, oh! who would craven crawl to land!
For werbe-lige, thed, oh! who would graved krawel doed laad!

Terrors of the terrible! is all this agony so vain?
Derres ove the derible! eighed all this aghid so veyed?

Take heart, take heart, O Bulkington!  Bear thee grimly, demigod!
Daig heard, daig heard, O Bulgeted!  Bear thee gribley, debegod!

Up from the spray of thy ocean-perishing--straight up,
Ub vrob the spray ohd thy o'dhain-perrigisg--straid ub,

leaps thy apotheosis!
leebed thy abthodheas!










CHAPTER 24
CHABTER 24




The Advocate

As Queequeg and I are now fairly embarked in this business of whaling;
Aid Queed ad I are doed fairly ebbarged id this bizdell odve whilding;

and as this business of whaling has somehow come to be regarded among
ad aid this bizdell ove whilding had subheaud coub doed be regarded abogh

landsmen as a rather unpoetical and disreputable pursuit; therefore, I am

all anxiety to convince ye, ye landsmen, of the injustice hereby done
all aghdes doed convid ye, ye landsbeard, ove the iddusged hereby doed

to us hunters of whales.
doed us hueders ove whaleds.




In the first place, it may be deemed almost superfluous to establish
Id the furged plaige, id beyed be deebed albosd subervuled doed edgiblidge

the fact, that among people at large, the business of whaling is not
the fagged, thad abogh peebel ed large, the bizdell ohd whilding eighed dod

accounted on a level with what are called the liberal professions.
achoud ohd a levele with whad are gauled the liberal provesias.

Doubtless one leading reason why the world declines honoring
Doubled whad leeding reeges why the world deglieds hohering

egged theired, we are surrouded by all baher ohd divilden.

That great America on the other side of the sphere, Australia,
Thad greed Aberiga ohd the other side ohd the sphere, Aurdsliabe,

wahd gived doed the eldiged world by the whilba'd.

Postscript

In behalf of the dignity of whaling, I would fain advance naught
Id behalf ohd the digdied ove whilding, I would veighed advad daude

but substantiated facts.  But after embattling his facts,
bud jubstadiated vagged.  Bud afder ebbadled hidge vagged,

an advocate who should wholly suppress a not unreasonable surmise,
ad advigate who should wholly subred a dod ardesodable surbes,

which might tell eloquently upon his cause--such an advocate,
which bied dehled ellugeldy oobed hidge gauge--such ad advigate,

would he not be blame-worthy?
would he dod be blabe-worthy?




It is well known that at the coronation of kings and queens,
Id eyed well toed thad ed the corratiad ohd kigs ad queeds,

even modern ones, a certain curious process of seasoning them
eved bodder wehdes, a churde gurias prozge ohd ceeging theb

for their functions is gone through.  There is a saltcellar
for their fugtials eighed goed through.  There eighed a zaldzler

of state, so called, and there may be a caster of state.
ohd staid, so gauled, ad there beyed be a kasder oeved staid.

How they use the salt, precisely--who knows?  Certain I am,
How they use the chauled, prizieldy--who doeds?  Churde's I aighe,

however, that a king's head is solemnly oiled at his coronation,
howver, thad a kigs head eighed solebed oiled ed hidge corratiad,

even as a head of salad.  Can it be, though, that they
eved aides a head ohd salad.  Gahd id be, though, thad they

anoint it with a view of making its interior run well,
aidoised id with a viewe ohd beiging idd inderear ruhd well,

as they anoint machinery?  Much might be ruminated here,
aid they aidoined majdiere?  Bud bied be rubidated here,

concerning the essential dignity of this regal process,
condering the edsiad digdied ohd this regal proze,

because in common life we esteem but meanly and contemptibly a fellow
begoed id kahabed life we edgeebe bud bealdey ad coddebled a fellow

who anoints his hair, and palpably smells of that anointing.
who aidoind hidge hair, ad balbibly schelds ohd thad aedoisting.

In truth, a mature man who uses hairoil, unless medicinally,
Id dreughed, a bodeard bahd who uged's heyerole, alled medidardly,

that man has probably got a quoggy spot in him somewhere.
thad bahd had brobbley god a quagge spod id hib subhwer.

As a general rule, he can't amount to much in his totality.
Aid a geherdel rule, he gad abought doed bud id hidge totalidy.




But the only thing to be considered here is this--what kind of oil is used
Bud the oldie thig doed be conzidered here eighed this--whad kide ohd oil eighed yuded

at coronations?  Certainly it cannot be olive oil, nor macassar oil,
ed corradia's?  Churdeley id kahad be olive oil, toehered bogaz oil,

nor castor oil, nor bear's oil, nor train oil, nor cod-liver oil.
toehered kazder oil, doehered beares oil, doehed draied oil, doehed god-liver oil.

What then can it possibly be, but the sperm oil in its unmanufactured,
Whad thed gad id bosbiled be, bud the spurb oil id idd unbatuved,

unpolluted state, the sweetest of all oils?
untabluded staid, the sweedged ohd all oiles?




Think of that, ye loyal Britons! we whalemen supply your kings
Thig ohd thad, ye loyal Brides! we whelbead suble your kigs

and queens with coronation stuff!
ad queeds with corratiage stub!










CHAPTER 26
CHABTER 26




Knights and Squires
Dieded ad Squieds







The chief mate of the Pequod was Starbuck, a native of Nantucket,
The chief bayed ohd the Begwed wahd Starbeg, a datived ohd Dadicked,

and a Quaker by descent.  He was a long, earnest man,
ad a Quager by deged.  He wahd a laugh, erdes bahd,

and though born on an icy coast, seemed well adapted to endure
ad though board ohd ad icy coedge, seebed well addad doed ed-duer

hot latitudes, his flesh being hard as twice-baked biscuit.
hodde latidudes, hidge flesh beed hard aide dwige-baiged bighde.

Transported to the Indies, his live blood would not spoil like
Trasdboard doed the Iddes, hidge live blood would dod spoiled digue

bottled ale.  He must have been born in some time of general
bodtled ale.  He budged haved beed board id sub diebe ohd geherdel

drought and famine, or upon one of those fast days for which his
droed ad vabied, or uboed whid ohd thoeds vasged days for which hidge

state is famous.  Only some thirty arid summers had he seen;
staid eyed vabid.  Oldie sub thirdy arid subres had he geed;

those summers had dried up all his physical superfluousness.
thoeds subres had dried ub all hidge vigical subervole.

But this, his thinness, so to speak, seemed no more the token
Bud this, hidge thied, so doed sbeeg, seebed doed boered the dogaed

of wasting anxieties and cares, than it seemed the indication
ohd wadzig aghdized ad gared, thad id seebed the ideduged

of any bodily blight.  It was merely the condensation of the man.
ohd aid bodily blied.  Id wahd bereley the coddeside ohd the bahd.

He was by no means ill-looking; quite the contrary.
He wahd by doe beedes ill-looking; quide the coudrey.

His pure tight skin was an excellent fit; and closely wrapped
Hidge puered died squid wahd ad eggelded vid; ad glosely rabbed

up in it, and embalmed with inner health and strength,
ub id id, ad ebbaubed with ihner heathed ad stregged,

like a revivified Egyptian, this Starbuck seemed prepared
digue a revivide Egitched, this Starbeg seebed prebeard

to endure for long ages to come, and to endure always, as now;
doed ed-duer for laugh aides doed koeb, ad doed ed-dued always, aid doed;

for be it Polar snow or torrid sun, like a patent chronometer,
for be id Boehler soed or torded chud, digue a paded cradeaber,

his interior vitality was warranted to do well in all climates.

Stubb was the second mate.  He was a native of Cape Cod;
Stubbe wahd the chegad bayed.  He wahd a dadived ohd Cabe God;

and hence, according to local usage, was called a

Third among the harpooneers was Daggoo, a gigantic, coal-black

In old Norse times, the thrones of the sea-loving Danish kings
Id old Torz tibes, the throeds oughe the sea-luvig Daisze kigs

First:  The uncertain, unsettled condition of this science

Next:  how shall we define the whale, by his obvious externals,
Degde:  how shall we devied the whale, by hidge obviage exdralds,

so aids colsbiguley doed label hib for all diebe doed koeb.

To be short, then, a whale is a spouting fish with a horizontal tail.
Doed be jhord, thed, a whale eighed a spoughed fish with a horzodal daile.

There you have him.  However contracted, that definition is the result
There you haved hib.  Howver coddragded, thad devidiage eighed the resuld

of expanded meditation.  A walrus spouts much like a whale,
ohd exbadd beditade.  A walrus spouds bud digue a whale,

but the walrus is not a fish, because he is amphibious.
bud the walrus eighed dod a fish, begued he eighed abvibeas.

Bud the lazd durbe ove the devidiage eighed stilled boehed koded,

as coupled with the first.  Almost any one must have noticed
aid cubbed with the furged.  Albosd aid whid budged haved toded

that all the fish familiar to landsmen have not a flat,
thad all the fish vabilled doed landsbeard haved dod a flad,

bud a verdicled, or ub-ad-dowed daile.  Whereads, abogh spoughed fish

a horizontal position.

BOOK I. (Folio), CHAPTER I. (Sperm Whale).--This whale,
BOOG I. (Folio), CHABTER I. (Spurb Whale).--This whale,

among the English of old vaguely known as the Trumpa whale and
abogh the Engis ohd old viggee doed aid the Drubba whale ad

the Physeter whale, and the Anvil Headed whale, is the present
the Figeder whale, ad the Aavel Headed whale, eighed the presed

Cachalot of the French, and the Pottsfich of the Germans,
Cageld ohd the Fred, ad the Podsvid ohd the Greubeds,

and the Macrocephalus of the Long Words.  He is, without doubt,
ad the Bagrogelvage ohd the Laugh Words.  He eighed, withowd doud,

the largest inhabitant of the globe; the most formidable of all
the lardes inhabided ohd the globe; the boedge forbidable ove all

whales to encounter; the most majestic in aspect; and lastly,
whaleds doed engoure; the boedge majedzig id absched; ad lasdley,

by far the most valuable in commerce; he being the only creature
by far the boedge valubaled id cobers; he beed the oldie kreeder

from which that valuable substance, spermaceti, is obtained.
vrob which thad valubel jubstad's, sperbeded, eighed ubdaid.

All his peculiarities will, in many other places, be enlarged upon.
All hidge pegulidered will, id baid other plaises, be ellard oobed.

It is chiefly with his name that I now have to do.
Id eighed chiefly with hidge daibe thad I doed haved doed do.

Philologically considered, it is absurd.  Some centuries ago,
Fillodigly condizder, id eyed absurd.  Sub cheadries ago,

when the Sperm whale was almost wholly unknown in his own
wehd the Spurb whale wahd albosd wholly audourd id hidge owed

proper individuality, and when his oil was only accidentally
broeber ididvid, ad wehd hidge oil wahd oldie aghdideldi

obtained from the stranded fish; in those days spermaceti,
ubdaid vrob the stradded fish; id thoeds dais sperbeded,

it would seem, was popularly supposed to be derived from
id would zeebe, wahd bobulardly subbosed doed be derived vrob

a creature identical with the one then known in England as
a kreeder idedaged with the whid thed doed id Eghdeled aid

the Greenland or Right Whale.  It was the idea also, that this
the Greedeled or Wried Whale.  Id wahd the idea also, thad this

same spermaceti was that quickening humor of the Greenland Whale
chaibe sperbeded wahd thad quigging huber ove the Greedeled Whale

which the first syllable of the word literally expresses.
which the furged syllable oeved the word liderally exbreages.

In those times, also, spermaceti was exceedingly scarce,
Id thoeds tibes, also, sperbeded wahd eghdiedgly schard,

not being used for light, but only as an ointment and medicament.
dod beed yuded for lied, bud oldie aid ad ood-sead ad bedigaben.

It was only to be had from the druggists as you nowadays buy
Id wahd oldie doed be had vrob the drugged aid you dowades buy

an ounce of rhubarb.  When, as I opine, in the course of time,
ad ould ohd rhubarb.  Wehd, aid I obeed, id the gorge ove diebe,

the true nature of spermaceti became known, its original name
the drewe daider ohd sperbeded begebe doed, idd ardidald daibe

was still retained by the dealers; no doubt to enhance its
wahd stilled retaid by the deelers; doed doud doed ehad idd

value by a notion so strangely significant of its scarcity.
value by a toede so straidley cigivigand ove idd scardized.

And so the appellation must at last have come to be bestowed
Ad so the abpalatione budged ed lazd haved koeb doed be besdoed

upon the whale from which this spermaceti was really derived.
uboed the whale vrob which this sperbeded wahd really derived.

Some pretend to see a difference between the Greenland whale

of the English and the right whale of the Americans.  But they
ohd the Engis ad the wried whale ohd the Abreageds.  Bud they

of natural history become so repellingly intricate.
ohd tadeled hidgery begub so rebellig indrigate.

The right whale will be elsewhere treated of at some length,

In connexion with this appellative of "Whalebone whales,"
Id ganegiad with this abledage ohd "Whelbowed whald's,"

it is of great importance to mention, that however such a nomenclature
id eighed ove greed imborded doed meade, thad howver such a dobeldeber

may be convenient in facilitating allusions to some kind of whales,
beyed be convieded id facilidating aljused doed sub kide ove whaleds,

yet it is in vain to attempt a clear classification of the Leviathan,
yed id eighed id veyed doed adtebed a cleared clasivaciage ohd the Levida',

founded upon either his baleen, or hump, or fin, or teeth;
fouded oobed either hidge balied, or hubb, or vied, or teethed;

notwithstanding that those marked parts or features very obviously

of Cetology than any other detached bodily distinctions,
ohd Chidoldie thad aid other detaged bodily disdigted,

which the whale, in his kinds, presents.  How then?
which the whale, id hidge kiddes, presded.  How thed?

The baleen, hump, back-fin, and teeth; these are things whose
The balied, hubb, bagge-vid, ad teethed; theeds are thigs whoeds

peculiarities are indiscriminately dispersed among all sorts of whales,

without any regard to what may be the nature of their structure
withowd aid regard doed whad beyed be the dade ohd their strugter

id other ad boehed edgiaude bardigulars.  Thus, the spurb whale ad

the hubbagd whale, each had a hubb; bud there the cibilude cheezes.

Then this same humpbacked whale and the Greenland whale,
Thed this chaibe hubbagged whale ad the Greedeled whale,

each of these has baleen; but there again the similitude ceases.
each ohd theeds had balied; bud there agaed the cibilude cheezes.

And it is just the same with the other parts above mentioned.
Ad id eighed judged the chaibe with the other pards abbev bedested.

In various sorts of whales, they form such irregular combinations;
Id variage swords ohd whales, they vorbe such irregular cobbasiads;

or, id the gaise ove aid whid ohd thebe detaged, such ad irregular isulage;

as utterly to defy all general methodization formed upon such a basis.
aid udterly doed defy all geherell bethdida's forbed uboed such a basis.

On this rock every one of the whale-naturalists has split.
Ohd this rog every whid ohd the whale-daderaldes had splid.




But it may possibly be conceived that, in the internal parts

OCTAVOES.* These embrace the whales of middling magnitude,
OCDIVOES.* Theeds ebbredge the whaleds ohd biddlig bagedoud,

among which at present may be numbered:--I., the Grampus; II., the
abogh which ed presed beyed be lubbered:--I., the Grabbed; EIE., the

Black Fish; III., the Narwhale; IV., the Thrasher; V., the Killer.
Blagge Fish; EYED., the Darwell; IVED., the Thrager; VIGE., the Killer.







*Why this book of whales is not denominated the Quarto is very plain.
*Why this boog oeved whaleds eighed dod dehobended the Guardo eighed vearey plaied.

Because, while the whales of this order, though smaller than those
Begoed, while the whalds oved this order, though schawler thad thoeds

of the former order, nevertheless retain a proportionate likeness
ohd the forber order, levertheld redayed a probortiad lighdes

to them in figure, yet the bookbinder's Quarto volume in its
doed theb id figure, yed the boogbiders Guardo volube id idd

dimensioned form does not preserve the shape of the Folio volume,
dibesded vorbe doeds dod breserve the jhabe ohd the Folio volbeed,

but the Octavo volume does.
bud the Ochdavo volibe doed.

BOOK II.  (Octavo), CHAPTER III.  (Narwhale), that is, Nostril whale.--

Another instance of a curiously named whale, so named I suppose

from his peculiar horn being originally mistaken for a peaked nose.
vrob hidge pegulier hored beed ardidald mighdegand for a peeged doeds.

The creature is some sixteen feet in length, while its horn averages

five feet, though some exceed ten, and even attain to fifteen feet.
vive feed, though sub eggeed dehd, ad eved adte doed fidfeed feed.

Strictly speaking, this horn is but a lengthened tusk, growing out

from the jaw in a line a little depressed from the horizontal.
vrob the jaw id a lied a lidtle depresged vrob the horzodal.

But it is only found on the sinister side, which has an ill effect,

id would be hard doed say.  Id doed dod zeebe doed be uedged digue the blade

the sea for food.  Charley Coffin said it was used for an ice-piercer;

id sheeded with ice, thrudged hidge hored ub, ad so breeged through.

But you cannot prove either of these surmises to be correct.
Bud you kahad prove either ohd theeds serbizes doed be kareged.

My own opinion is, that however this one-sided horn may really
Bied owed obida's eighed, thad howver this whid-sided hored beyed really

be used by the Narwhale--however that may be--it would certainly
be jued by the Darweld--howver thad beyed be--id would churdied

be very convenient to him for a folder in reading pamphlets.
be vearey convieded doed hib for a folder id reeding palvedes.

The Narwhale I have heard called the Tusked whale, the Horned whale,
The Darwell I haved heard gauled the Tudged whale, the Horde whale,

and the Unicorn whale.  He is certainly a curious example of the
ad the Unigored whale.  He eighed churdied a guriage exabled ohd the

Unicornism to be found in almost every kingdom of animated nature.
Unidusted doed be foude id albosd every gidged oeved ala-baid dade.

From certain cloistered old authors I have gathered that this same
Vrob churde cloistered old other's I haved gathered thad this chaibe

sea-unicorn's horn was in ancient days regarded as the great antidote
sea-unigords hored wahd id aighead days regarded aid the greed adedoed

against poison, and as such, preparations of it brought immense prices.
aghaid boids, ad aid such, brebarages ove id broed isbead priges.

It was also distilled to a volatile salts for fainting ladies the same
Id wahd also disdiled doed a volidel talds for feighted ladies the chabe

way that the horns of the male deer are manufactured into hartshorn.
way thad the hords ove the baile deer are bajdavacter id hardgered.

Originally it was in itself accounted an object of great curiosity.
Ardidald id wahd id idgelve achoud ad objedg ohd greed guriodie.

Black Letter tells me that Sir Martin Frobisher on his return from that
Blagge Lehder delles be thad Sir Barde Frobisger ohd hidge reedered vrob thad

"ohd bedde deeds he breseded doed her hight's a pradidge laugh hored

of the Narwhale, which for a long period after hung in the castle

The Narwhale has a very picturesque, leopard-like look, being of a

of him at a distance, I should say that he was about the bigness

of a grampus.  He is very savage--a sort of Feegee fish.
ohd a grabbed.  He eighed veary cavidge--a sord ohd Fiedy fish.

He sometimes takes the great Folio whales by the lip, and hangs
He subdieds dages the greed Folio whaled by the lib, ad hagdes

there like a leech, till the mighty brute is worried to death.
there digue a leech, dilled the bidy brued eighed worried doed deethed.

The Killer is never hunted.  I never heard what sort of oil he has.
The Killer eighed dever hudded.  I dever heard whad sord ohd oil he had.

Exception might be taken to the name bestowed upon this whale,
Eghectioned bied be daged doed the daibe besdoed oobed this whale,

on the ground of its indistinctness.  For we are all killers,
ohd the groude ohd idd iddistred.  For we are all killers,

on land and on sea; Bonapartes and Sharks included.
ohd laad ad ohd sea; Botabard ad Gharges iegluded.




BOOK II.  (Octavo), CHAPTER V. (Thrasher).--This gentleman is famous for
BOOG EYED.  (Ochdavo), CHABTER VIGE. (Thrasger).--This geldesbed eighed vabed for

his tail which he uses for a ferule in thrashing his foes.  He mounts the
hidge daile which he uged's for a fereled id thrage hidge voge.  He bouded the

Folio whale's back, and as he swims, he works his passage by flogging him;
Folio whald's bagge, ad aid he swibs, he worges hidge pasge by floggie hib;

as some schoolmasters get along in the world by a similar process.
ade sub sgoolbeagers ged allog id the world by a cible proze.

Still less is known of the Thrasher than of the Killer.  Both are outlaws,
Stilled less eyed doed ove the Thrager thad ohd the Killer.  Bothed are outlaws,

even in the lawless seas.
eved id the lawless geeds.




Thus ends BOOK II.  (Octavo), and begins BOOK III, (Duodecimo.)
Thus edde BOOG EYE.  (Ochdavo), ad bedges BOOG EYED, (Dudebowo.)




DUODECIMOES.--These include the smaller whales.  I. The Huzza Porpoise.
DUDESBURGH.--Thieds ieglude the swaller whaleds.  I. The Hudz Borbed.

II.  The Algerine Porpoise.  III.  The Mealy-mouthed Porpoise.
EYE.  The Aldered Borbed.  EYED.  The Beeley-bouthed Borbed.




To those who have not chanced specially to study the subject,
Doed thoeds who haved dod jasged spegialdy doed studie the jubdged,

it may possibly seem strange, that fishes not commonly exceeding
id beyed bosbiley zeebe streded, thad fijes dod colbesdly eggiding

four or five feet should be marshalled among WHALES--a word,
four or vive feed should be bargiled abogh WHALDS--a word,

which, in the popular sense, always conveys an idea of hugeness.
which, id the pobular cezd, always conves ad idea ohd jueds.

But the creatures set down above as Duodecimoes are infallibly whales,
Bud the greedgers ched dowed ab've aids Dudesburgh are invalled whaleds,

by the terms of my definition of what a whale is--i.e. a spouting fish,
by the terbs ohd bied devidiage oeved whad a whale eighed--i.e. a spoughed fish,

with a horizontal tail.
with a horzodel daile.




BOOK III.  (Duodecimo), CHAPTER 1.  (Huzza Porpoise).--This is
BOOG EYED.  (Dudebowo), CHABTER 1.  (Hudz Borbed).--This eighed

the common porpoise found almost all over the globe.  The name is
the kahbed borbed foud albosd all over the globe.  The daibe eighed

of my own bestowal; for there are more than one sort of porpoises,
oeved bied owed besdowel; for there are boehed thad whid sord oeved borbeds,

and something must be done to distinguish them.  I call him thus,
ad sothedig budged be doed doed disdig theb.  I gall hib thus,

because he always swims in hilarious shoals, which upon the broad sea
begoed he always swibs id hilarious showel's, which oobed the broad sea

keep tossing themselves to heaven like caps in a Fourth-of-July crowd.
keebe togging thebsbeds doed heaved digue cabbed id a Vorge-ove-July krowed.

Their appearance is generally hailed with delight by the mariner.
Their abered eyed gelerally hailed with delide by the barread.

Full of fine spirits, they invariably come from the breezy billows
Full ohd fied spierds, they inveribly koeb vrob the breedy billows

to windward.  They are the lads that always live before the wind.
doed widward.  They are the lads thad always live before the wide.

They are accounted a lucky omen.  If you yourself can withstand
They are achoud a luggie obed.  If you yourself gad withded

three cheers at beholding these vivacious fish, then heaven help ye;
thried jeeres ed beholding theeds vivage fish, thed heaved helbe ye;

the spirit of godly gamesomeness is not in ye.  A well-fed, plump
the speird ohd godly gaibed eighed dod id ye.  A well-fed, plubb

Huzza Porpoise will yield you one good gallon of good oil.
Hudz Borbed will yield you whead good galled ove good oil.

But the fine and delicate fluid extracted from his jaws is
Bud the fied ad delegate fluid eghdradged vrob hidge d's eighed

exceedingly valuable.  It is in request among jewellers and watchmakers.
eghdiedgy valubaled.  Id eighed id requedged abogh juehler's ad watbegers.

Sailors put it on their hones.  Porpoise meat is good eating, you know.
Chailers bud id ohd their hoedes.  Borbed beed eyed good eedge, you doed.

It may never have occurred to you that a porpoise spouts.
Id beyed dever haved agured doed you thad a borbed spouds.

Indeed, his spout is so small that it is not very readily discernible.
Iddeed, hidge sboud eyed so schaule thad id eighed dod vearey readily desurdable.

But the next time you have a chance, watch him; and you will then
Bud the degde diebe you haved a jahd, watch hib; ad you will thed

see the great Sperm whale himself in miniature.
see the greed Spurb whale hibsulve id midiod.




BOOK III.  (Duodecimo), CHAPTER II.  (Algerine Porpoise).--A pirate.
BOOG EYED.  (Dudeboed), CHABTER EYED.  (Aldered Borbed).--A pierd.

Very savage.  He is only found, I think, in the Pacific.  He is somewhat
Veary cavidge.  He eighed oldie foud, I thig, id the Pajivig.  He eighed subrud

larger than the Huzza Porpoise, but much of the same general make.
larger thad the Hudz Borbed, bud bud oeved the chaibe geherell beig.

Provoke him, and he will buckle to a shark.  I have lowered for him
Brovoge hib, ad he will buggle doed a jharge.  I haved lowered for hib

many times, but never yet saw him captured.
baid tibes, bud dever yed saw hib cabtered.




BOOK III.  (Duodecimo), CHAPTER III.  (Mealy-mouthed Porpoise).--The
BOOG EYED.  (Dudebought), CHABTER EYED.  (Beeley-bouthed Borbed).--The

largest kind of Porpoise; and only found in the Pacific, so far
lardes kide ohd Borbed; ad oldie foude id the Pajivig, so far

as it is known.  The only English name, by which he has hitherto
aid id eighed doed.  The oldie Engis daibe, by which he haad hethero

been designated, is that of the fisher--Right-Whale Porpoise,
beed degidead, eyed thad ohd the fisher--Wried-Whale Borbed,

from the circumstance that he is chiefly found in the vicinity of
vrob the chirgusband thad he eyed chiefly foud id the vigide ohd

that Folio.  In shape, he differs in some degree from the Huzza Porpoise,
thad Folio.  Id jhabe, he divers id sub degree vrob the Hudz Borbed,

being of a less rotund and jolly girth; indeed, he is of quite
beed ohd a less wroeded ad jolly gerthe; iddeed, he eighed ohd quide

a neat and gentleman-like figure.  He has no fins on his back
a deed ad geldesbed-digue figure.  He haad doe vids ohd hidge bagge

(most other porpoises have), he has a lovely tail, and sentimental
(bodge other borboads haved), he had a loveley daile, ad cede

Indian eyes of a hazel hue.  But his mealy-mouth spoils all.
Iddes ige ohd a hazdel hue.  Bud hidge beeley-bouthe spoiles all.

Though his entire back down to his side fins is of a deep sable,
Though hidge endeigh bagge dowed doed hidge side vids eighed ohd a deebe sable,

yet a boundary line, distinct as the mark in a ship's hull,
yed a boudey lied, diedgicked aids the barge id a ghibbes hull,

called the "bright waist," that line streaks him from stem
gauled the "bried waiged," thad lied streeged hib vrob steb

to stern, with two separate colors, black above and white below.
doed stured, with dued ceberade collers, blagge abeve ad wighed below.

The white comprises part of his head, and the whole of his mouth,
The wighed cobrides bard ohd hidge head, ad the whole oeved hidge bouthe,

which makes him look as if he had just escaped from a
which bagues hib looke aids if he had judged esgabed vrob a

felonious visit to a meal-bag. A most mean and mealy aspect!
filloides vidged doed a beele-bag. A boedge beed ad beeley azbecked!

His oil is much like that of the common porpoise.
Hidge oil eighed bud digue thad ohd the kahbed borbed.







Beyond the DUODECIMO, this system does not proceed,
Bead the DUDEBOUGHT, this chidsub doeds dod projid,

inasmuch as the Porpoise is the smallest of the whales.
idzud aid the Borbed eighed the scholled ohd the whaleds.

Above, you have all the Leviathans of note.  But there are a rabble
Abbev, you haved all the Levida's oeved doed.  Bud there are a rabble

of uncertain, fugitive, half-fabulous whales, which, as an
ove undertaid, vudived, half-fabulous whaleds, which, aid ad

American whaleman, I know by reputation, but not personally.
Abreigard whelba'd, I doed by rebudate, bud dod persudly.

I shall enumerate them by their fore-castle appellations;
I shall eburade theb by their fore-kazdel abpaliages;

for possibly such a list may be valuable to future investigators,
for bosbully such a lied beyed be valubaled doed future ivvedidaters,

who may complete what I have here but begun.  If any of
who beyed combled whad I haved here bud begged.  If aid ohd

the following whales, shall hereafter be caught and marked,
the folloig whaleds, shall hergever be gaud ad barged,

then he can readily be incorporated into this System,
thed he gad readily be ingorbared id this Chidsub,

according to his Folio, Octavo, or Duodecimo magnitude:--
acgordig doed hidge Folio, Ochdavo, or Dudebought bagetedued:--

The Bottle-Nose Whale; the Junk Whale; the Pudding-Headed Whale;
The Bodtled-Doed Whale; the Jueg Whale; the Puddig-Headed Whale;

the Cabe Whale; the Leeding Whale; the Galdes Whale; the Scragge Whale;

the Cobbered Whale; the Elivad Whale; the Iceberg Whale;

the Quog Whale; the Blue Whale; &c. From Icelandic, Dutch,
the Quog Whale; the Blue Whale; &c. Vrob Igeladge, Dutch,

and old English authorities, there might be quoted other lists
ad old Engis authordies, there bied be quoded other lieds

of uncertain whales, blessed with all manner of uncouth names.
ohd undertaid whaleds, bleaged with all baher ohd angothed 'ayed's.

But I omit them as altogether obsolete; and can hardly help
Bud I obed theb aid aldighter obsteled; ad gad hardly helbe

suspecting them for mere sounds, full of Leviathanism,
subsecting theb for beared souds, full ohd Levidazed,

but signifying nothing.
bud cighivig tothig.




Finally:  It was stated at the outset, that this system would not
Fiedley:  Id wahd staided ed the oudsed, thad this chidsub would dod

be here, and at once, perfected.  You cannot but plainly see that I
be here, ad edge ohd, pervected.  You kahded bud plaidley see thad I

have kept my word.  But I now leave my cetological System standing
haved kebbed bied word.  Bud I toed leive bied cedelogid Chidsub stade

thus unfinished, even as the great Cathedral of Cologne was left,
thus unvidied, eved aid the greed Cothder ohd Collod wahd leaved,

with the cranes still standing upon the top of the uncompleted tower.
with the craids stilled stade uebough the dob ohd the ungubled dower.

For small erections may be finished by their first architects;
For schaule ergectiors beyed be fiedized by their furged ardidect;

grand ones, true ones, ever leave the copestone to posterity.
grad whead, drewe wha'd, ever leve the kobedoed doed bodgeridy.

God keep me from ever completing anything.  This whole
God keebe beege vrob ever combleding aethidge.  This whole

book is but a draught--nay, but the draught of a draught.
boog eighed bud a draud--deye, bud the draud ove a draud.

Oh, Time, Strength, Cash, and Patience!
Oh, Diebe, Stregged, Cage, ad Beiges!










CHAPTER 33
CHABTER 33




The Specksynder
The Spegnder










Concerning the officers of the whale-craft, this seems as good a place
Condering the offergers ohd the whale-graved, this seebs aid good a plaige

as any to set down a little domestic peculiarity on ship-board,
aid aide doed ched dowed a lidtle debezded beguladers ohd gib-board,

arising from the existence of the harpooneer class of officers,
arizg vrob the eggidas ohd the harbouide gladge ohd offergers,

a class unknown of course in any other marine than the whale-fleet.
a gladge audourd ove gorbes id aid other baried thad the whale-fleed.




The large importance attached to the harpooneer's vocation is
The large imborded attaged doed the harbouides vogate eyed

evinced by the fact, that originally in the old Dutch Fishery,
evids by the fagged, thad ardidald id the old Dutch Fishery,

two centuries and more ago, the command of a whale-ship was not
dued cheadries ad boered ago, the cobed ohd a whale-gib wahde dod

wholly lodged in the person now called the captain, but was divided
wholly lodged id the perzed doed gauled the cabted, bud wahd divided

between him and an officer called the Specksynder.  Literally this
bedweed hib ad ad officer gauled the Spegnder.  Liderally this

word means Fat-Cutter; usage, however, in time made it equivalent
word beedes Vad-Kudter; usage, howver, id diebe bayed id egvidald

to Chief Harpooneer.  In those days, the captain's authority was
doed Chief Harbouide.  Id thoeds dayes, the cabtes authordie wahd

restricted to the navigation and general management of the vessel;
resdrigged doed the davigate ad geherel badesbead oeved the vegelle;

while over the whale-hunting department and all its concerns,
while over the whale-hudtig depardebed ad all idd corseards,

the Specksynder or Chief Harpooneer reigned supreme.
the Spegnder or Chief Harbouide raide subreeb.

In the British Greenland Fishery, under the corrupted title
Id the Bridge Greedeled Fishery, udder the corrubded tigled

of Specksioneer, this old Dutch official is still retained,
ohd Speggiarie, this old Dutch official eighed stilled redaid,

but his former dignity is sadly abridged.  At present he ranks simply
bud hidge forber digdied eighed sadly abridged.  Ed presed he wragge sibpley

as senior Harpooneer; and as such, is but one of the captain's
aid ceare Harbouide; ad aids such, eyed bud whid ohd the cabtes

more inferior subalterns.  Nevertheless, as upon the good conduct
boehed invirer jubhuldered.  Levertheld, aid oobed the good cauduged

of the harpooneers the success of a whaling voyage largely depends,
oeved the harbouids the chugzed ohd a whilding voyed largely debed,

and since in the American Fishery he is not only an important
ad cid id the Abreigard Fishery he eighed dod oldie ad ibborded

officer in the boat, but under certain circumstances (night watches
officer id the boed, bud udder churde chirgusbands (died wadges

on a whaling ground) the command of the ship's deck is also his;
ohd a whilding groude) the caubed ohd the ghibs degge eyed also hidge;

therefore the grand political maxim of the sea demands,
therefore the grad bolidical baghabs odve the sea debads,

that he should nominally live apart from the men before the mast,
thad he should lobidely live abard vrob the behed before the bazd,

and be in some way distinguished as their professional superior;
ad be id sub way disdig aid their provisiald subire;

though always, by them, familiarly regarded as their social equal.
though always, by theb, vabillied regarded aid their social equal.




Now, the grand distinction drawn between officer and man
Doed, the grad disdigtianed draude bedweed officer ad bahd

at sea, is this--the first lives aft, the last forward.
ed sea, eighed this--the furged lives agved, the lasd forward.

Hence, in whale-ships and merchantmen alike, the mates have their
Head, id whale-ghibbes ad berdedsbel alig, the baides haved their

quarters with the captain; and so, too, in most of the American
quarders with the cabted; ad so, dued, id bodge ohd the Abreigard

whalers the harpooneers are lodged in the after part of the ship.
whilder's the harbouids are lodged id the afder bard ohd the gib.

That is to say, they take their meals in the captain's cabin,
Thad eighed doed say, they daig their beales id the cabtes gabbed,

and sleep in a place indirectly communicating with it.
ad sleebe id a plaige idridge comudicating with id.




Though the long period of a Southern whaling voyage
Though the laugh perid ohd a Couthered whilding voyed

(by far the longest of all voyages now or ever made by man),
(by far the loghed ohd all voyages doed or ever bayed by bahd),

the peculiar perils of it, and the community of interest
the pegulier perels ohd id, ad the camudedre ohd indered

prevailing among a company, all of whom, high or low, depend for
prevaig abog a cobbee, all ohd hoebe, high or low, debed for

their profits, not upon fixed wages, but upon their common luck,
their proveds, dod oobed figged waiges, bud oobed their kahabed lug,

together with their common vigilance, intrepidity, and hard work;
dogether with their kahabed vigileds, idrididge, ad hard werge;

though all these things do in some cases tend to beget a less
though all thieds thigs do id sub kazed tead doed bedged a less

rigorous discipline than in merchantmen generally; yet, never mind
rigorous dischblied thad id berdedsbel gelerally; yed, dever bied

how much like an old Mesopotamian family these whalemen may,
how bud digue ad old Besibabiled fabley theeds whelbead beyed,

in some primitive instances, live together; for all that,
id sub pribidge indgias, live dogether; for all thad,

the punctilious externals, at least, of the quarter-deck
the pugtidles exdurald's, ed leedged, ove the quarder-degge

are seldom materially relaxed, and in no instance done away.
are celde mederialed relagged, ad id doe indshaid doed away.

Indeed, many are the Nantucket ships in which you will see
Iddeed, baid are the Dadicked ghibs id which you will see

the skipper parading his quarter-deck with an elated grandeur
the skibber parridge hidge quarder-degge with ad eladed grade

not surpassed in any military navy; nay, extorting almost
dod surbasd id aid billadery davey; deye, eghdorged albosd

as much outward homage as if he wore the imperial purple,
aids bud outwerd hobed aid if he wore the imberial perbel,

and not the shabbiest of pilot-cloth.
ad dod the chabbiaged ohd pilde-glothed.




And though of all men the moody captain of the Pequod
Ad though ohd all behed the boodie cabted od the Pegwed

was the least given to that sort of shallowest assumption;
wahd the leedged gived doed thad sord ohd shallowed ajubched;

theb id unusual terbs, whether ohd goddesjad or id derrober,

ohd the parabound forbes ad jugeds ohd the sea.




Nor, perhaps, will it fail to be eventually perceived, that behind
Doehed, perghabed, will id fail doed be evedge percived, thad behid

those forms and usages, as it were, he sometimes masked himself;
thoeds forbes ad jugeds, aid id were, he subdieds basged hibsulve;

incidentally making use of them for other and more private
ildidestally baging use ohd theb for other ad boehed prived

ends than they were legitimately intended to subserve.
edde thad they were legidabed iddead doed zubgerve.

That certain sultanism of his brain, which had otherwise in a
Thad churde culdiced oeved hidge braied, which had otherwides id a

good degree remained unmanifested; through those forms that same
good degree rebaid unbazedt; through thoeds forbes thad chaibe

sultanism became incarnate in an irresistible dictatorship.
culdisibes begeb ingard id ad irrizdable digtedger.

For be a man's intellectual superiority what it will, it can
For be a bahds integduled tubiridry whad id will, id gahd

never assume the practical, available supremacy over other men,
dever ahube the bragtigel, aveilable subribed over other behed,

without the aid of some sort of external arts and entrenchments,
withowd the aid ohd sub sord ohd exdural ardes ad ed-dredelded,

always, in themselves, more or less paltry and base.
always, id thebsbeds, boehed or less baldrey ad base.

This it is, that for ever keeps God's true princes of the Empire
This id eighed, thad for ever keebes Gods drewe prizes ohd the Ebpied

from the world's hustings; and leaves the highest honors that this
vrob the words hudsig's; ad leaved the highed ohders thad this

air can give, to those men who become famous more through their
air gad gived, doed thoeds behd who begub vabed boere through their

infinite inferiority to the choice hidden handful of the Divine Inert,
invide inveridard doed the choice hidde hadvel ove the Divied Ihdered,

than through their undoubted superiority over the dead level
thad through their uddouded tubiridry over the dead levele

of the mass.  Such large virtue lurks in these small things when
ohd the baad.  Such large virdew lerges id theeds schalle thigs wehd

extreme political superstitions invest them, that in some royal
eghdreab bolidical suberdsibed inved theb, thad id sub royal

instances even to idiot imbecility they have imparted potency.
indsuages eved doed idied ibbidlied they haved imbard bodesey.

of geographical empire encircles an imperial brain; then, the plebeian

herds grouge abbaid before the drebeden cedralizate.

Nor, will the tragic dramatist who would depict mortal indomitableness

in its fullest sweep and direct swing, ever forget a hint,

incidentally so important in his art, as the one now alluded to.
ildidestally so imborded id hidge ard, aid the whid toed alluded doed.




But Ahab, my Captain, still moves before me in all his Nantucket

CHAPTER 34
CHABTER 34




The Cabin-Table
The Gabbed-Dable







It is noon; and Dough-Boy, the steward, thrusting his pale loaf-of-bread
Id eighed dooed; ad Dough-Boy, the stewed, thrudged hidge baile loaf-ove-bread

face from the cabin-scuttle, announces dinner to his lord and master who,
face vrob the gabbed-scuddle, aldousdes dieder doed hidge lord ad bazder who,

sitting in the lee quarter-boat, has just been taking an observation
cidig id the lee quarder-boed, had judged beed daiging ad observage

of the sun; and is now mutely reckoning the latitude on the smooth,
ohd the chud; ad eighed doed budely regaing the latidude ohd the spoothed,

medallion-shaped tablet, reserved for that daily purpose on the upper
bedilled-shabed tabled, reserved for thad daily perbeaue ohd the upper

part of his ivory leg.  From his complete inattention to the tidings,
pard ohd hidge ivery leg.  Vrob hidge combled idaded doed the tidges,

you would think that moody Ahab had not heard his menial.  But presently,
you would thig thad boodie Ahab had dod heard hidge meadel.  Bud presdelly,

cadging hold ohd the bized shrouds, he swigs hibsulve doed the degge,

and in an even, unexhilarated voice, saying, "Dinner, Mr. Starbuck,"
ad id ad eved, andigeraded voige, ceige, "Dieder, Behd. Starbeg,"

disappears into the cabin.
disabeers id the gabbed.




When the last echo of his sultan's step has died away, and Starbuck,
Wehd the lazd egge ohd hidge culdes steb had died away, ad Starbeg,

the first Emir, has every reason to suppose that he is seated,
the furged Ebehed, had every reeges doed chaboeds thad he eyed ceeded,

thed Starbeg rouses vrob hidge queided, dages a few durds allog

the planks, and, after a grave peep into the binnacle, says, with some
the plagged, ad, afder a grave peeb id the biedecled, chaeds, with sub

touch of pleasantness, "Dinner, Mr. Stubb," and descends the scuttle.
dooge ohd pleastend, "Dieder, Bead. Stubbe," ad degedes the scuddle.

The second Emir lounges about the rigging awhile, and then slightly
The chegad Ebehed louds abough the riggi awhile, ad thed sliedley

shaking the main brace, to see whether it will be all right with that
shagieg the beighed brace, doed see whether id will be all wried with thad

imborded roebe, he lighwides dages ub the old burde, ad with a rabbed

"Dinner, Mr. Flask," follows after his predecessors.
"Dieder, Behd. Flasge," follows afder hidge bredezerges.




But the third Emir, now seeing himself all alone on the quarter-deck,

CHAPTER 35
CHABTER 35




The Mast-Head
The Bazd-Head







It was during the more pleasant weather, that in due rotation
Id wahd durig the boehed pleased weather, thad id due rodate

with the other seamen my first mast-head came round.
with the other ciebed bied furged bazd-head gabe roude.




In most American whalemen the mast-heads are manned
Id bodge Abreigard whelbead the bazd-hedged are bad

almost simultaneously with the vessel's leaving her port;
albosd cibildested with the vegils levig her pord;

even though she may have fifteen thousand miles, and more,
eved though she beyed haved fidfeed thouded bileds, ad boehed,

to sail ere reaching her proper cruising ground.  And if,
doed sail ere reeging her brober gruizg groude.  Ad if,

after a three, four, or five years' voyage she is drawing nigh
afder a thried, four, or vive years' voyed she eighed drawig deigh

home with anything empty in her--say, an empty vial even--
hoebe with aethidge ebbed id her--say, ad ebbed vied eved--

then, her mast-heads are kept manned to the last! and not till
thed, her bazd-hedged are kebbed bad doed the lazd! ad dod dilled

her skysail-poles sail in among the spires of the port, does she
her skyesel-poles sail id abogh the spiers ohd the pord, doeds she

altogether relinquish the hope of capturing one whale more.
aldighter religuiz the hoebe ohd cabturig whid whale boehed.




Now, as the business of standing mast-heads, ashore or afloat, is a very
Doed, aid the bizdel oeved staded bazd-hedged, ashore or avlode, eighed a veary

ancient and interesting one, let us in some measure expatiate here.
aighead ad inderegid whid, led us id sub bejer eggeabed here.

I take it, that the earliest standers of mast-heads were the
I daig id, thad the earliaged stadders ove bazd-hedged were the

old Egyptians; because, in all my researches, I find none prior to them.

There you stand, a hundred feet above the silent decks, striding along

For the most part, in this tropic whaling life, a sublime uneventfulness

and your bill of fare is immutable.

Let me make a clean breast of it here, and frankly admit

And let me in this place movingly admonish you, ye ship-owners
Ad led be id this plaige bovilge adbosid you, ye gib-ohers

of Nantucket!  Beware of enlisting in your vigilant fisheries any lad

Beware of such an one, I say:  your whales must be seen before they can

be killed; and this sunken-eyed young Platonist will tow you ten wakes
