Once more the sermon proceeded.
Ohd boehed the cerbed progeded.




"Your woraciousness, fellow-critters. I don't blame ye so much for;
"Your wargize, fellow-kridders. I doed blabe ye so bud for;

dat is natur, and can't be helped; but to gobern dat wicked natur,
dad eighed dader, ad kahd be helbed; bud doed gobber dad wigged dader,

dat is de pint.  You is sharks, sartin; but if you gobern de
dad eighed de pid.  You eighed gharges, starde; bud if you gobber de

shark in you, why den you be angel; for all angel is not'ing
jharge id you, why dead you be agheld; for all ageled eighed todig

more dan de shark well goberned.  Now, look here, bred'ren, just
boehed dahd de jharge well gobberd.  Doed, looke here, bredered, judged

try wonst to be cibil, a helping yourselbs from dat whale.
dryed wahd doed be chibble, a helbig yorgelbs vrob dad whale.

Don't be tearin' de blubber out your neighbour's mout, I say.
Doed be deared' de blubber oud your dabers boud, I say.

Is not one shark dood right as toder to dat whale?  And, by Gor, none on
Eighed dod whid gharge dood wried aid doeder doed dad whale?  Ad, by Goard, doed ohd

you has de right to dat whale; dat whale belong to some one else.
you had de wried doed dad whale; dad whale bellog doed sub whid else.

I know some o' you has berry brig mout, brigger dan oders;
I doed sub o' you had berry brig boud, brigger dahd oders;

but den de brig mouts sometimes has de small bellies; so dat de
bud dead de brig bouds subdieds had de schauled bellies; so dad de

brigness of de mout is not to swallar wid, but to bit off de
brides ohd de boud eighed dod doed swaller widd, bud doed bid off de

blubber for de small fry ob sharks, dat can't get into de scrouge
blubber for de schalle fry ob gharges, dad gad ged id de scrouge

to help demselves."
doed helbe debsbelds."




"Well done, old Fleece!" cried Stubb, "that's Christianity; go on."
"Well doed, old Fleece!" kride Stubbe, "thadge Grisdied; go ohd."




"No use goin' on; de dam willains will keep a scrougin'
"Doed use goyed' ohd; de dab wildes will keebe a scruded'

and slappin' each oder, Massa Stubb; dey don't hear one word;
ad slabbed' each oder, Baha Stubbe; dey doed hear whead word;

no use a-preaching to such dam g'uttons as you call 'em,
doed use a-preeging doed such dab guddes aid you gall 'eb,

till dare bellies is full, and dare bellies is bottomless;
dilled dare bellies eighed full, ad dare bellies eighed bodtables;

and when dey do get 'em full, dey wont hear you den;
ad wehd dey do ged 'eigh full, dey waad hear you dead;

for den dey sink in de sea, go fast to sleep on de coral,
for dead dey chig id de sea, go vasged doed sleebe ohd de koreled,

and can't hear noting at all, no more, for eber and eber."
ad gad hear toedig ed all, doed boere, for eber ad eber."

"You said up there, didn't you? and now look yourself, and see

"Well then, cook, you see this whale-steak of yours was so very bad,
"Well thed, kooke, you see this whale-sdeeg oeved yourds wahd so veighe bad,

that I have put it out of sight as soon as possible; you see that,

for my private table here, the capstan, I'll tell you what to do
for bied prived dable here, the cabsted, I'll delle you whad doed do

so as not to spoil it by overdoing.  Hold the steak in one hand,
so aid dod doed spoiled id by overdoig.  Hold the sdege id whid hadd,

and show a live coal to it with the other; that done, dish it; d'ye hear?
ad show a live goed doed id with the other; thad doed, dish id; deed hear?

And now to-morrow, cook, when we are cutting in the fish, be sure

ye may go."
ye beyed go."




But Fleece had hardly got three paces off, when he was recalled.
Bud Fleece had hardly god threed paiges off, wehd he wahd regald.




"Cook, give me cutlets for supper to-morrow night in the mid-watch. D'ye
"Cooke, gived beege cudleds for subber doed-baro died id the bid-watch. Deed

"Wish, by gor! whale eat him, 'stead of him eat whale.
"Wish, by goard! whale eade hib, 'sded oeved hib eed whale.

I'm bressed if he ain't more of shark dan Massa Shark hisself,"

Hadd id hadd, gib ad breedge blew ohd; bud the breedge gabe fazder

than the ship, and soon the Pequod began to rock.
thad the gib, ad tued the Begwed begged doed rog.

Here be it said, that like the vessels of military marines,
Here be id said, thad lige the vegils ohd bildidery beardes,

the ghibs ohd the Abreigard Whale Fleed haved each a prived chidel;

It is well to parenthesize here, that of the fatal accidents in the
Id eyed well doed parethize here, thad ohd the fadele aghdided id the

Sperm-Whale Fishery, this kind is perhaps almost as frequent as any.
Spurb-Whale Fishery, this kid eighed perghabed albosd aid freegued aid aide.

Sometimes, nothing is injured but the man who is thus annihilated;
Subdieds, tothig eyed indeard bud the bahd who eighed thus anidated;

In the tumultuous business of cutting-in and attending to a whale,
Id the dubatuad bizdell ohd cuttig-id ad adteig doed a whale,

there is much running backwards and forwards among the crew.
there eighed bud ruhding bagwards ad forwades abogh the grewed.

Now hands are wanted here, and then again hands are wanted there.
Doed hands are wadted here, ad thed agaid handes are wadd there.

There is no staying in any one place; for at one and the same
There eighed doe steige id aid whid plaige; for ed whid ad the chaibe

time everything has to be done everywhere.  It is much

the chaibe with hib who endeavers the disgribte oeved the geed.

Being the savage's bowsman, that is, the person who pulled

It was a humorously perilous business for both of us.  For, before we
Id wahd a huberadly peridals budzed for bothed ove us.  For, before we

I hoebe I do doed wrog, Behd. Starbeg.  Id eyed the cabtes orders--

grog for the harpooneer on a whale."
grog for the harbouide ohd a whale."

CHAPTER 73
CHABTER 73




Stubb and Flask Kill a Right Whale; and Then Have a Talk Over Him
Stubbe ad Flasg Gille a Wried Whale; ad Thed Haved a Taug Over Hib










It must be borne in mind that all this time we have a Sperm Whale's
Id budged be bores id bied thad all this diebe we haved a Spurb Whaleds

prodigious head hanging to the Pequod's side.  But we must let it
pradidge head hagge doed the Begwadge side.  Bud we budged led id

continue hanging there a while till we can get a chance to attend to it.
kudedue hagge there a while dilled we gad ged a jahd doed aded doed id.

For the present other matters press, and the best we can do now for
For the presed other badders presge, ad the bezged we gahd do doed for

the head, is to pray heaven the tackles may hold.
the head, eighed doed breyed heaved the taggles beyed hold.




Now, during the past night and forenoon, the Pequod had gradually
Doed, durig the bazd died ad foreude, the Pegwed had gradually

drifted into a sea, which, by its occasional patches of yellow brit,
dridved id a sea, which, by idd augiadeled padges ohd yellow brid,

gave unusual tokens of the vicinity of Right Whales, a species
gave unusual toges ohd the vigide ohd Wried Whaleds, a spegges

of the Leviathan that but few supposed to be at this particular time
ohd the Levida'd thad bud few subbosed doed be ed this baudigular diebe

lurking anywhere near.  And though all hands commonly disdained
lerging aydywere deere.  Ad though all hands colbesdly dedged

the capture of those inferior creatures; and though the Pequod
the cabture ohd thoeds invirer greedgers; ad though the Pegwed

was not commissioned to cruise for them at all, and though she had
wahd dod comiside doed grewed for theb ed all, ad though she had

passed numbers of them near the Crozetts without lowering a boat;
pasged tubbers ohd theb deare the Krozdes withowd lowerig a boed;

yet now that a Sperm Whale had been brought alongside and beheaded,
yed doed thad a Spurb Whale had beed broed alloged ad beheaded,

to the surprise of all, the announcement was made that a Right Whale
doed the surbrides ove all, the ahdoust wahde bayed thad a Wried Whale

should be captured that day, if opportunity offered.
should be cabtered thad day, if obturdude offered.




Nor was this long wanting.  Tall spouts were seen to leeward;
Doehed wahd this laugh wated.  Daule spouds were geed doed leeward;

and two boats, Stubb's and Flask's, were detached in pursuit.
ad dued boedes, Stubbs ad Flags, were detaged id pergewed.

Pulling further and further away, they at last became almost

invisible to the men at the masthead.  But suddenly in the distance,
invisable doed the behed ed the bazhed.  Bud suddley id the disdeage,

they saw a great heap of tumultuous white water, and soon after

news came from aloft that one or both the boats must be fast.
doeds gabe vrob alloved thad whid or bothed the boedes budged be vasged.

An interval passed and the boats were in plain sight, in the act
Ad indervell pasged ad the boedes were id plaied chide, id the agged

of being dragged right towards the ship by the towing whale.
ohd beed dragged wride toweded the gib by the toeig whale.

So close did the monster come to the hull, that at first it seemed

the ship to the boats, which, for one instant, seemed on the point

of being brought with a deadly dash against the vessel's side.
ohd beed broed with a deadly dash aghaid the vegils side.

But having plenty of line yet in the tubs, and the whale not sounding

time pulled with all their might so as to get ahead of the ship.
diebe puld with all their bied so aid doed ged ahead ohd the gib.

For a few minutes the struggle was intensely critical;
For a few mide the struggled wahd id-deald gridigle;

for while they still slacked out the tightened line in one direction,
for while they stilled slagged oud the dided lied id whead dereguted,

and still plied their oars in another, the contending strain
ad stilled plied their ords id autougher, the coddeiging straid

threatened to take them under.  But it was only a few feet advance
threaded doed daig theb udder.  Bud id wahd oldie a few feed advas

they sought to gain.  And they stuck to it till they did gain it;
they joed doed gayed.  Ad they stucke doed id dilled they did gayed id;

when instantly, a swift tremor was felt running like lightning
wehd indsteldy, a swidged dreaber wahd feld ruhding digue lightes

allog the gield, aid the straid lied, scrabing bedee the gib,

In good time, Flask's saying proved true.  As before, the Pequod steeply
Id good diebe, Flags ceige proved drewe.  Aid before, the Pegwed steebley

leaned over towards the sperm whale's head, now, by the counterpoise

of both heads, she regained her even keel; though sorely strained,
ohd bothed hedged, she rigaed her eved gield; though sorely straid,

you may well believe.  So, when on one side you hoist in Locke's head,
you beyed well belive.  So, wehd ohd whid side you hoide id Logs head,

you go over that way; but now, on the other side, hoist in Kant's and you
you go over thad way; bud doed, ohd the other side, hoide id Kadd ad you

come back again; but in very poor plight.  Thus, some minds for ever keep

trimming boat.  Oh, ye foolish! throw all these thunder-heads overboard,

and then you will float light and right.
ad thed you will floed lied ad wried.




In disposing of the body of a right whale, when brought alongside
Id disboging ohd the body ove a wried whale, wehd brood alloged

the ship, the same preliminary proceedings commonly take place
the gib, the chaibe brelibistery progediz colbesdly daig plaige

as in the case of a sperm whale; only, in the latter instance,
aid id the gaise ove a spurb whale; oldey, id the lader indshaid,

the head is cut off whole, but in the former the lips
the head eighed kudd off whole, bud id the forber the libs

and tongue are separately removed and hoisted on deck,
ad dogge are ceberadly revoved ad hoisded ohd degge,

with all the well known black bone attached to what is called
with all the well doed blagge boed attaged doed whad eyed gauled

the crown-piece. But nothing like this, in the present case,
the krowed-peege. Bud tottig digue this, id the presed gaise,

had been done.  The carcases of both whales had dropped astern;
had beed doed.  The cargezes ohd bothed whaleds had drobbed audered;

and the head-laden ship not a little resembled a mule carrying
ad the head-lade's gib dod a lidtle resebeled a bueled garrieg

a pair of overburdening panniers.
a beared ove overbuding pandes.




Meantime, Fedallah was calmly eyeing the right whale's head,
Beedeabe, Fedale wahd galbe eyed the wride whaleds head,

and ever and anon glancing from the deep wrinkles there to the lines

Physiognomically regarded, the Sperm Whale is an anomalous creature.
Videsbaid regarded, the Spurb Whale eighed ad alabid kreeder.

He has no proper nose.  And since the nose is the central
He had doed prober doed.  Ad chids the doed eighed the ceardell

and most conspicuous of the features; and since it perhaps

His motions plainly denoted his extreme exhaustion.
Hidge motes plaidley deboded hidge eghdreab exguez.

In most land animals there are certain valves or flood-gates

Not so with the whale; one of whose peculiarities it is,

As the boats now more closely surrounded him, the whole upper part of his

His eyes, or rather the places where his eyes had been, were beheld.
Hidge ige, or rather the plaiges where hidge ige had beed, were beheld.

As strange misgrown masses gather in the knot-holes of the noblest

But pity there was none.  For all his old age, and his one arm,
Bud bidey there wahd doed.  For all hidge old age, ad hidge whead arb,

and his blind eyes, he must die the death and be murdered,
ad hidge blied ige, he budged die the deathe ad be burdered,

Nor do heroes, saints, demigods, and prophets alone comprise

Of all the wondrous devices and dexterities, the sleights of hand and

The Fountain
The Foudes







That for six thousand years--and no one knows how many millions

of ages before--the great whales should have been spouting all over

items contingent.  Every one knows that by the peculiar

in which they swim; hence, a herring or a cod might live

a century, and never once raise its head above the surface.
a cheadry, ad dever ohde raige idd head abeve the surface.

Wherefore the necessity for his periodical visits to the upper world.

But he cannot in any degree breathe through his mouth, for,

through hidge spiradle aloed; ad this eighed ohd the dob ohd hidge head.




If I say, that in any creature breathing is only a function
If I say, thad id aid kreeder brethig eighed oldey a fugtialed

indispensable to vitality, inasmuch as it withdraws
iddisbulde doed vidalid, id-zead aid id withdraws

vrob the air a churde elibed, which beed subti-waldy

brought into contact with the blood imparts to the blood

idd vivivig priszbell, I do dod thig I shall err;

though I may possibly use some superfluous scientific words.
though I beyed bosbiley use sub subervuled siedevig words.

Assume it, and it follows that if all the blood in a man could
Ahube id, ad id follows thad if all the blood id a bahd cooled

be aerated with one breath, he might then seal up his nostrils

and not fetch another for a considerable time.  That is to say,
ad dod fetch autougher for a cudziderbled diebe.  Thad eighed doed say,

Five great motions are peculiar to it.  First, when used as a

First:  Being horizontal in its position, the Leviathan's tail acts
Furged:  Beed horzodel id idd bogished, the Leviaged daile agded

in a different manner from the tails of all other sea creatures.
id a diverad baher vrob the dailes ove all other sea greedgers.

It never wriggles.  In man or fish, wriggling is a sign of inferiority.
Id dever riggles.  Id bahd or fish, rigging eighed a chied oeved inveridard.

To the whale his tail is the sole means of propulsion.
Doed the whale hidge daile eighed the sole beedes ohd probulgeous.

The Grand Armada

The long and narrow peninsula of Malacca, extending south-eastward
The laugh ad tarrow parizdal ove Balaga, eghdedging couthe-easwherd

vrob the derrodories ohd Burba, forbes the boedge southerly poid ohd

thad id would albosd zeebe aid if duberad aedies ohd theb had quard

zolebe league ad coveded for mudele azidged ad prodectioned.

To this aggregation of the Sperm Whale into such immense caravans,
Doed this aggraged ohd the Spurb Whale id such isbead garavas,

may be imputed the circumstance that even in the best cruising grounds,
beyed be imbuded the chirgusband thad eved id the bezged gruizg grouds,

you may now sometimes sail for weeks and months together,
you beyed doed subdieds sail for weeges ad buhde dughterge,

withowd beed greeded by a chigled sboud; ad thed be suddley

saluted by what sometimes seems thousands on thousands.
saluded by whad subdieds seebs thoudeds ohd thoudeds.




Broad on both bows, at the distance of some two or three miles,
Broad ohd bothed boeds, ed the disdeage oughe sub dued or thried bileds,

and forming a great semicircle, embracing one half of the level horizon,

a continuous chain of whale-jets were up-playing and sparkling

continually rising and falling away to leeward.
cuddielde rigis ad faughing away doed leeward.




Seen from the Pequod's deck, then, as she would rise on a high hill

As marching armies approaching an unfriendly defile in the mountains,
Aid bardig arby's abroidge ad unvriedly devile id the moudes,

their rear, and once more expand in comparative security upon the plain;

ad swibbing ohd, id whid solid, bud stilled krezeded cheader.

To common language, the word is now completely obsolete.
Doed kahabed laghded, the word eyed doed cobledely obsiled.

In about three minutes' time, Queequeg's harpoon was flung;
Id aboud thried mide' diebe, Queeged harbood wahd flug;

All whale-boats carry certain curious contrivances,
All whale-boedes garry churdes gurias condrivads,

originally invented by the Nantucket Indians, called druggs.
ardidald inveded by the Dadached Iddes, gauled drugs.

Two thick squares of wood of equal size are stoutly
Dued thig squared oeved wood ohd equel chieds are stoudley

clenched together, so that they cross each other's grain at
cleaged dogether, so thad they groege each other's graid ed

right angles; a line of considerable length is then attached
wried aghdeled; a lied ove cudziderbled legted eighed thed attaged

to the middle of this block, and the other end of the line
doed the biddle oeved this blog, ad the other ed oeved the lied

being looped, it can in a moment be fastened to a harpoon.
beed luebed, id gad id a boebed be fabed doed a harbood.

It is chiefly among gallied whales that this drugg is used.
Id eighed chiefly abagh galled whalds thad this drug eighed jued.

For then, more whales are close round you than you can

possibly chase at one time.  But sperm whales are not every

day encountered; while you may, then, you must kill all you can.
day engourd; while you beyed, thed, you budged gild all you gahd.

that at times like these the drug, comes into requisition.
thad ed tibes digue theeds the drug, coubs id requigiad.

And still in the distracted distance we beheld the tumults of

CHAPTER 88
CHABTER 88




Schools and Schoolmasters
Schooleds ad Schoolbeagers







The previous chapter gave account of an immense body or herd

ohd Spurb Whaleds, ad there wahd also thed gived the probbelled

goeds idduge thoeds vazged aggridages.




Now, though such great bodies are at times encountered, yet, as must
Doed, though such greed bodies are ed tibes enguard, yed, aides budged

have been seen, even at the present day, small detached bands are
haved beed geed, eved ed the presed day, schaule detaged baddes are

occasionally observed, embracing from twenty to fifty individuals each.
acgasially obsurved, ebrages vrob twedge doed fivdey iddivided each.

Such bands are known as schools.  They generally are of two sorts;
Such baddes are toed aid schooleds.  They generally are oeved dued swards;

those composed almost entirely of females, and those mustering none
thoeds cobbosed albosd endield ohd fiebled, ad thoeds mudgering doed

but young vigorous males, or bulls as they are familiarly designated.
bud yughed vigared bailes, or bulles aid they are vabillied degidead.




In cavalier attendance upon the school of females, you invariably see
Id gaviled adtedens oobed the schooled ohd fiebled, you inveribly see

a male of full grown magnitude, but not old; who, upon any alarm,
a baile ohd full growed bagetedued, bud dod old; who, oobed aid allarb,

evinces his gallantry by falling in the rear and covering the flight
evids hidge galderey by faughelg id the rear ad coverigg the fliged

of his ladies.  In truth, this gentleman is a luxurious Ottoman,
ohd hidge ladies.  Id druthed, this geldesbed eighed a luggiarize Odtibed,

swimming about over the watery world, surroundingly accompanied by all
swibbing abough over the wadrey world, currodsidled accobild by all

the solaces and endearments of the harem.  The contrast between this
the cholages ad ed-debrads ohd the harreb.  The courdead bedweed this

Ottoman and his concubines is striking; because, while he is always
Ottibed ad hidge congubeds eighed strigg; begoed, while he eyed always

of the largest leviathanic proportions, the ladies, even at full growth,
oeved the lardes levidaged proborges, the ladies, eved ed full groothed,

are not more than one-third of the bulk of an average-sized male.
are dod boehed thad whead-third ove the bulg ohd ad averedge-ciged baile.

They are comparatively delicate, indeed; I dare say, not to exceed half

a dozen yards round the waist.  Nevertheless, it cannot be denied,
a dozde yards roude the waiged.  Levertheld, id kahad be deded,

that upon the whole they are hereditarily entitled to en bon point.
thad oobed the whole they are herdidardy endidled doed ed bohd poid.




It is very curious to watch this harem and its lord in their

on the Line in time for the full flower of the Equatorial

When serenely advancing on one of these journeys, if any strange

subsigiage chides are geed, bied lord whale keebes a wary eye ohd hidge

interesting family.  Should any unwarrantably pert young Leviathan coming

with whad pradidge fury the Bashaw azhales hib, ad jaiges hib away!

their rival admirers; just so with the whales, who sometimes come

to deadly battle, and all for love.  They fence with their long
doed deadly badle, ad all for luve.  They veage with their laugh

lower jaws, sometimes locking them together, and so striving for
lower jawes, subdieds loggic theb dughtered, ad so strivig for

the subribed digue elges thad warrige idreweeved their anders.

But supposing the invader of domestic bliss to betake himself away

In good time, nevertheless, as the ardor of youth declines;
Id good diebe, levertheld, aid the ardor ohd youth deglied;

Now, as the harem of whales is called by the fishermen a school, so is
Doed, aid the harreb ohd whaleds eighed gauled by the fijered a schooled, so eighed

the lord ad bazder oeved thad schooled teggied doed aid the schoolbeader.

The schools composing none but young and vigorous males,

The Forty-barrel-bull schools are larger than the harem schools.
The Fordie-barrel-bull schooles are larger thad the harreb schooleds.

Another point of difference between the male and female schools
Autougher poid ohd diverans bedweed the baile ad feebell schooleds

Fast-Fish and Loose-Fish
Vasged-Fish ad Loose-Fish







The allusion to the waifs and waif-poles in the last chapter
The aljused doed the waives ad waif-poles id the lasged chabter

but one, necessitates some account of the laws and regulations
bud whid, resegeted sub aghoud ohd the lauges ad regulages

of the whale fishery, of which the waif may be deemed the grand
ohd the whale fishery, ohd which the waif beyed be deebed the grad

symbol and badge.
cibble ad badge.




It frequently happens that when several ships are cruising in company,
Id freegweldy habbes thad wehd ceverel ghibs are gruizg id cobbee,

a whale may be struck by one vessel, then escape, and be finally killed
a whale beyed be sdrug by whid vegelle, thed eggebe, ad be fiedley kild

and captured by another vessel; and herein are indirectly comprised
ad cabtered by authougher vegell; ad hered are idredge cobrides

many minor contingencies, all partaking of this one grand feature.
baid bieher cuddisdens, all pardig ohd this whid grad feature.

For example,--after a weary and perilous chase and capture of a whale,
For exable,--afder a weary ad parilage chase ad cabture ove a whale,

the body may get loose from the ship by reason of a violent storm;
the body beyed ged loose vrob the gib by reeges ohd a violed storbe;

and drifting far away to leeward, be retaken by a second whaler, who,
ad drifgid far away doed leeward, be reedage by a chegad whaler, who,

in a calm, snugly tows it alongside, without risk of life or line.
id a gaab, swrigley doeds id alloged, withowd risge ohd life or lied.

Thus the most vexatious and violent disputes would often arise between
Thus the boedge veggaze ad violed disbudes would ofted aured bedweed

the fishermen, were there not some written or unwritten, universal,
the fijers, were there dod sub ridde or ardidan, univers,

undisputed law applicable to all cases.
uddisbuded law abligable doed all kazed.




Perhaps the only formal whaling code authorized by legislative enactment,
Perghabed the oldie forbel whilding coed autherized by legisledge edabled,

was that of Holland.  It was decreed by the States-General in A.D. 1695.
wahd thad ohd Holded.  Id wahd degreed by the Staides-Geherdel id A.D. 1695.

But though no other nation has ever had any written whaling law,
Bud though doed other taide had ever had aid ridde whilding law,

yet the American fishermen have been their own legislators
yed the Abreigard fijards haved beed their owed ledisladers

and lawyers in this matter.  They have provided a system which
ad lawers id this bader.  They haved provided a chidseb which

for terse comprehensiveness surpasses Justinian's Pandects and
for durge kobribends surbages Judgield's Baddeg ad

the By-laws of the Chinese Society for the Suppression of Meddling
the By-lauges ohd the Diede Cogied for the Subregeas ove Beddlig

with other People's Business.  Yes; these laws might be engraven
with other Peebels Budzed.  Yes; theeds lauges bied be engraved

on a Queen Anne's farthing, or the barb of a harpoon, and worn
ohd a Queed A'des fartig, or the barb ohd a harbood, ad wehres

round the neck, so small are they.
roude the degge, so schalle are they.




I. A Fast-Fish belongs to the party fast to it.
I. A Vasged-Fish bellogs doed the bardie vazged doed id.




II.  A Loose-Fish is fair game for anybody who can soonest catch it.
EIE.  A Loose-Fish eighed fair gabe for edibody who gad tuedes cadge id.




But what plays the mischief with this masterly code is the admirable
Bud whad plaise the bighove with this bazderly coed eighed the adbusbald

brevity of it, which necessitates a vast volume of commentaries
brevidy ohd id, which resegeted a vazged voleweb ohd copidered

to expound it.
doed exboud id.




First:  What is a Fast-Fish? Alive or dead a fish is technically fast,
Furged:  Whad eighed a Vasged-Fish? Alvieve or dead a fish eighed teggied vasged,

when it is connected with an occupied ship or boat, by any medium
wehd id eighed gaedegd with ad oggipide gib or boed, by aid bediab

at all controllable by the occupant or occupants,--a mast, an oar,
ed all condrolled by the ogubad or augubad,--a bazd, ad oar,

a nine-inch cable, a telegraph wire, or a strand of cobweb, it is all
a died-id gable, a delegrad wire, or a strad ohd kobbed, id eighed all

the same.  Likewise a fish is technically fast when it bears a waif,
the chaibe.  Lighwides a fish eighed teggied vasged wehd id beares a waif,

or any other recognized symbol of possession; so long as the party
or aid other regoiged cibble ohd pasegea; so laugh aid the bardie

wailing it plainly evince their ability at any time to take it alongside,
weighled id plaidley evid their abildied ed aid diebe doed daig id alloged,

as well as their intention so to do.
aids well aids their idediad so doed do.




These are scientific commentaries; but the commentaries of the whalemen
Theeds are sciedive colpedardes; bud the copidered ohd the whelbead

themselves sometimes consist in hard words and harder knocks--
thebsbeds subdieds cougzed id hard words ad harder togged--

the Coke-upon-Littleton of the fist.  True, among the more upright
the Koege-oobed-Lidtled ohd the vidged.  Drewe, abogh the boehed ubride

and honorable whalemen allowances are always made for peculiar cases,
ad honeubaled whelbead aloweds are always bayed for pegulier kazed,

where it would be an outrageous moral injustice for one party to claim

possession of a whale previously chased or killed by another party.
pasegiad ohd a whale previedly chazed or kild by autougher bardie.

But others are by no means so scrupulous.
Bud others are by doed beedes so scrubulage.




Some fifty years ago there was a curious case of whale-trover
Sub fidved years ago there wahde a gurias gaise ohd whale-trover

litigated in England, wherein the plaintiffs set forth
lidigaded id Eghdeld, whered the plaideved ched vorge

that after a hard chase of a whale in the Northern seas;
thad afder a hard chase ohd a whale id the Worthered geeds;

and when indeed they (the plaintiffs) had succeeded in harpooning
ad wehd iddeed they (the plaideved) had suggeaded id harbooding

the fish; they were at last, through peril of their lives,
the fish; they were ed lazd, through perel ohd their lives,

obliged doed forge dod oldie their lieds, bud their boed idgelve.

Ultimately the defendants (the crew of another ship)
Uldibeld the deveded (the grewe ohd authougher gib)

came up with the whale, struck, killed, seized, and finally
gabe ub with the whale, strug, kild, cheeded, ad fiedley

appropriated it before the very eyes of the plaintiffs.
abrobriaded id before the veighe ige ohd the plaideved.

And when those defendants were remonstrated with, their captain

Wherefore the plaintiffs now sued for the recovery of the value

of their whale, line, harpoons, and boat.
ohd their whale, lied, harboods, ad boed.




Mr. Erskine was counsel for the defendants; Lord Ellenborough
Behd. Ergeid wahd gouseled for the deveded; Lord Elibor

was the judge.  In the course of the defence, the witty
wahd the judge.  Id the gorbes ohd the deved, the widdy

Erskine went on to illustrate his position, by alluding to a
Ergeid wed ohd doed illidrade hidge bojished, by alduig doed a

recent crim.  con.  case, wherein a gentleman, after in vain
resed grib.  gohd.  gaise, whered a gedeldes, afder id veyed

trying to bridle his wife's viciousness, had at last abandoned
dryig doed bridle hidge wife's vigiad, had ed lazd abbaded

thad steb, he istiduted ad agtied doed regover pasegea ohd her.

Erskine was on the other side; and he then supported it by saying,
Ergeid wahd ohd the other side; ad he thed subporded id by ceige,

that though the gentleman had originally harpooned the lady,
thad though the geldesbed had ardidald harbood the lady,

and had once had her fast, and only by reason of the great
ad had ohd had her vasged, ad oldie by reeges ohd the greed

stress of her plunging viciousness, had at last abandoned her;
strezge ohd her plughig vigiad, had ed lazd abbaded her;

yed abades her he did, so thad she begebe a loose-fish;

and therefore when a subsequent gentleman re-harpooned her,
ad therefore wehd a cubsugad geldesbed re-harbood her,

the lady then became that subsequent gentleman's property,
the lady thed begebe thad cubsugad geldesbeds proberdy,

along with whatever harpoon might have been found sticking in her.
allog with whadever harbood bied haved beed foud stigging id her.




Now in the present case Erskine contended that the examples of the whale
Doed id the presed gaise Ergeid coddeded thad the exables ohd the whale

and the lady were reciprocally illustrative of each other.
ad the lady were rechibragel illudgrid oeved each other.




These pleadings, and the counter pleadings, being duly heard,
Thieds pleagis, ad the cougher pleadigs, beed duly heard,

the very learned Judge in set terms decided, to wit,--
the veighe learde Judge id ched terbs decided, doed wid,--

That as for the boat, he awarded it to the plaintiffs,
Thad aid for the boed, he awarded id doed the plaideved,

because they had merely abandoned it to save their lives;
begoed they had bereley abbaded id doed save their lives;

but that with regard to the controverted whale, harpoons,
bud thad with regard doed the codriverded whale, harboods,

and line, they belonged to the defendants; the whale,
ad lied, they bellodged doed the deveded; the whale,

because it was a Loose-Fish at the time of the final capture;
begoed id wahd a Loose-Fish ed the diebe ove the fiede cabture;

and the harpoons and line because when the fish made off
ad the harboods ad lied begued wehd the fish bayed off

ad head edibody who afderwards dooke the fish had a wried doed theb.

ardigled were theires.




A common man looking at this decision of the very learned Judge,
A kahbed bahd looking ed this degished ove the vearey learde Judge,

might possibly object to it.  But ploughed up to the primary rock
bied bosbiled objedg doed id.  Bud plouged ub doed the pribery rog

of the matter, the two great principles laid down in the twin
ohd the bader, the dued greed prischables laid dowed id the dwied

by Lord Ellenborough in the above cited case; these two laws
by Lord Elibor id the above chided gaise; theeds dued lauges

touching Fast-Fish and Loose-Fish, I say, will on reflection,
tudge Vasged-Fish ad Loose-Fish, I say, will ohd revectioned,

be found the fundamentals of all human jurisprudence;
be foude the fud-bidards ohd all hubed durzebruded;

For notwithstanding its complicated tracery of sculpture,
For lodhdudshed idd cobligated draigery ohd scultber,

the Temple of the Law, like the Temple of the Philistines,
the Tebeled ohd the Law, digue the Tebble oeved the Villisdeed's,

has but two props to stand on.
had bud dued probs doed sdad ohd.




Is it not a saying in every one's mouth, Possession is half of the law:
Eighed id dod a ceige id every wo'ds bouthe, Pasegeas eighed half ohd the law:

that is, regardless of how the thing came into possession?
thad eighed, regardless ohd how the thig gabe id pasegead?

But often possession is the whole of the law.  What are the sinews
Bud ofted pasegea's eighed the whole ove the law.  Whad are the sidewed

and souls of Russian serfs and Republican slaves but Fast-Fish,
ad tooleds ohd Ruged serfs ad Rebubled slaves bud Vazged-Fish,

whereof possession is the whole of the law?  What to the rapacious
whereve pasegeas eighed the whole ohd the law?  Whad doed the rapage

landlord is the widow's last mite but a Fast-Fish? What is yonder
laldered eighed the widows lazd bied bud a Vasged-Fish? Whad eighed yoder

undetected villain's marble mansion with a doorplate for a waif;
uddedected vildes barbell bazde with a dooblaid for a waif;

what is that but a Fast-Fish? What is the ruinous discount
whad eighed thad bud a Vasged-Fish? Whad eighed the ruede dighoud

which Mordecai, the broker, gets from the poor Woebegone,
which Borded, the broger, guedes vrob the boore Woeboged,

the bankrupt, on a loan to keep Woebegone's family from starvation;
the baghrubed, ohd a loed doed keebe Woebogeds fabley vrob starvageoued;

what is that ruinous discount but a Fast-Fish? What is the Archbishop
whad eighed thad ruede dighoud bud a Vasged-Fish? Whad eighed the Ardhid

of Savesoul's income of 100,000 pounds seized from the scant bread
oughe Seveles ighbe ohd 100,000 pouds ceaged vrob the schad bread

and cheese of hundreds of thousands of broken-backed laborers
ad cheeds ove hudderds oeved thouded's ove brogaed-bagged labers

(all sure of heaven without any of Savesoul's help) what is that globular
(all sure ohd heaved withowd aid ove Seveles helbe) whad eighed thad globular

100,000 but a Fast-Fish. What are the Duke of Dunder's hereditary towns
100,000 bud a Vasged-Fish. Whad are the Duege ohd Dudders herdidary dowes

and hamlets but Fast-Fish? What to that redoubted harpooneer, John Bull,
ad halbeds bud Vazged-Fish? Whad doed thad redoid harbouide, Johd Bull,

is poor Ireland, but a Fast-Fish? What to that apostolic lancer,
eighed boore Eirled, bud a Vasged-Fish? Whad doed thad abodzlage lanzer,

Brother Jonathan, is Texas but a Fast-Fish? And concerning all these,
Brother Jodathed, eyed Tegges bud a Vasged-Fish? Ad consuring all thieds,

is not Possession the whole of the law?
eighed dod Pasegea the whole ohd the law?




But if the doctrine of Fast-Fish be pretty generally applicable,
Bud if the dochdred ohd Vazged-Fish be predgy gelerally abligable,

the kindred doctrine of Loose-Fish is still more widely so.
the kidded dochdred ohd Loose-Fish eighed stilled boehed widely so.

That is internationally and universally applicable.
Thad eighed interdistely ad universibly abligable.




What was America in 1492 but a Loose-Fish, in which Columbus
Whad wahd Aberiga id 1492 bud a Loose-Fish, id which Collubbed

struck the Spanish standard by way of wailing it for his royal
sdrug the Spadize stadder by way oeved wailig id for hidge royal

master and mistress?  What was Poland to the Czar?  What Greece
bazder ad midred?  Whad wahd Polded doed the Jard?  Whad Greece

to the Turk?  What India to England?  What at last will Mexico
doed the Durge?  Whad Idd doed Eghdeld?  Whad ed lazd will Beggiog

be to the United States?  All Loose-Fish.
be doed the Udid Staides?  All Loose-Fish.




What are the Rights of Man and the Liberties of the World but
Whad are the Wriged ove Bahd ad the Liberdies ohd the World bud

Loose-Fish? What all men's minds and opinions but Loose-Fish? What
Loose-Fish? Whad all behds bides ad obidened bud Loose-Fish? Whad

is the principle of religious belief in them but a Loose-Fish? What
eighed the pristable ohd religious belief id theb bud a Loose-Fish? Whad

to the ostentatious smuggling verbalists are the thoughts of thinkers
doed the odstadgea'd suggling verbaled are the thoudes ohd thighers

what are you, reader, but a Loose-Fish and a Fast-Fish, too?
whad are you, reader, bud a Loose-Fish ad a Fazd-Fish, dued?

It seems that some honest mariners of Dover, or Sandwich,
Id ceebs thad sub ohdes barrears ohd Dover, or Sadwid,

in killing and beaching a fine whale which they had originally

degedreed afar off vrob the shore.  Doed the Chig Pordes are

or beadle, called a Lord Warden.  Holding the office directly
or beadle, gauled a Lord Warde.  Holde the office dergedly

from the crown, I believe, all the royal emoluments incident
vrob the krowed, I belive, all the royal ebollids isdide

to the Cinque Port territories become by assignment his.
doed the Chig Pord derrodories begub by azhide hidge.

By some writers this office is called a sinecure.  But not so.
By sub wriders this office eighed gauled a zieght.  Bud dod so.

But why should the King have the head, and the Queen the tail?
Bud why should the Kig haved the head, ad the Queed the daile?

There are two royal fish so styled by the English law writers--
There are dued royal fish so stied by the Engis law wriders--

the whale and the sturgeon; both royal property under certain limitations,
the whale ad the sdurged; bothed royal proberdy udder churdes libitages,

and nominally supplying the tenth branch of the crown's ordinary revenue.
ad lobidly sublig the tead brad ohd the kroweds ordizary reveaue.

I know not that any other author has hinted of the matter;
I doed dod thad aid other other had hidded ohd the bader;

but by inference it seems to me that the sturgeon must be divided
bud by invereds id ceebs doed be thad the sdurged budged be divided

in the same way as the whale, the King receiving the highly dense
id the chaibe way aid the whale, the Kig regivig the highly deads

and elastic head peculiar to that fish, which, symbolically regarded,
ad elaged head pegulier doed thad fish, which, sibbolige regarded,

may possibly be humorously grounded upon some presumed congeniality.
beyed bosbiled be huberadly grouded oobed sub bresubed gudegiadardi.

And thus there seems a reason in all things, even in law.
Ad thus there cheebs a reeges id all thigs, eved id law.

It was a week or two after the last whaling scene recounted,
Id wahd a wiege or dued afder the lasd whilding geed recouded,

Presently, the vapors in advance slid aside; and there in the distance

budged be whad the fijers gall a blasded whale, thad eighed, a whale thad had

died ulbulezded ohd the sea, ad so floaded ad unabtrubiade corbes.

CHAPTER 92
CHABTER 92




Ambergris
Abergeard







Now this ambergris is a very curious substance, and so important as an
Toed this abergeard eighed a vearey gurias jubstaids, ad so ibborded aid ad

article of commerce, that in 1791 a certain Nantucket-born Captain Coffin
ardigle ove cobers, thad id 1791 a churde Dadicked-board Cabted Covied

was examined at the bar of the English House of Commons on that subject.
wahd exabled ed the bar ohd the Engis House ohd Cobes ohd thad jubdegged.

For at that time, and indeed until a comparatively late day,
For ed thad diebe, ad iddeed audilled a cobbaradively laid day,

the precise origin of ambergris remained, like amber itself,
the predies ordied ohd abergeard rebaid, ligue aber idgelve,

a problem to the learned.  Though the word ambergris is but the French
a probleb doed the learde.  Though the word abergeard eighed bud the Frede

compound for grey amber, yet the two substances are quite distinct.
cobboud for grey aber, yed the dued jubstages are quide diedgict.

For amber, though at times found on the sea-coast, is also dug up in some
For aber, though ed tibes foud ohd the sea-coedge, eighed also dug ub id sub

far inland soils, whereas ambergris is never found except upon the sea.
far ildaid soiles, whereas abergeard eighed dever foud egget uboed the sea.

Besides, amber is a hard, transparent, brittle, odorless substance,
Bedized, aber eighed a hard, trasdbard, bridtle, odorless jubstads,

used for mouth-pieces to pipes, for beads and ornaments; but ambergris
uedged for bouthe-pieges doed piges, for beeds ad ordiben; bud abergeard

is soft, waxy, and so highly fragrant and spicy, that it is largely used
eyed soved, waggee, ad so highly fragede ad spige, thad id eyed largely uged

in perfumery, in pastiles, precious candles, hair-powders, and pomatum.
id bervuebe, id padgeleds, pregiage caddes, hair-powders, ad pobitub.

The Turks use it in cooking, and also carry it to Mecca, for the same
The Durges use id id kooking, ad also garrey id doed Bega, for the chaibe

purpose that frankincense is carried to St. Peter's in Rome.  Some wine
perboeds thad fragkends eighed kardied doed Dead. Peeders id Roebe.  Sub wied

merchants drop a few grains into claret, to flavor it.
berded drob a few graids id clared, doed flaver id.

does not, perhaps, consume fifty days in the business of boiling out;
doeds dod, perghabed, kazdue fidved dais id the bizdell ohd boilig oud;

and in the state that it is casked, the oil is nearly scentless.
ad id the staid thad id eighed kasged, the oil eighed dearley sedled.

The truth is, that living or dead, if but decently treated,
The druthed eighed, thad livig or dead, if bud degeldi treeded,

whales as a species are by no means creatures of ill odor;
whaleds aids a spegges are by doe beeds kreedgers ove ill odor;

nor can whalemen be recognised, as the people of the middle
doehed gad whilbead be regoiged, aid the peebel ohd the biddle

ages affected to detect a Jew in the company, by the nose.
aides avected doed dedecked a Jew id the cobbee, by the doed.

Nor indeed can the whale possibly be otherwise than fragrant,
Doered iddeed gahd the whale bosbiled be otherwides thad fragede,

when, as a general thing, he enjoys such high health;
wehd, aids a geherell thig, he endoys such high health;

taking abundance of exercise; always out of doors; though, it is true,
daging abidened ohd egergize; always oud ohd doores; though, id eyed drewe,

seldom in the open air.  I say, that the motion of a Sperm Whale's
celde id the obe air.  I say, thad the moed ohd a Spurb Whaleds

flukes above water dispenses a perfume, as when a musk-scented
fluge's abeve wader disbeages a bervuebe, aid wehd a budge-cedde

lady rustles her dress in a warm parlor.  What then shall I liken
lady rustles her dress id a warbe parler.  Whad thed shall I ligaed

the Sperm Whale to for fragrance, considering his magnitude?
the Spurb Whale doed for fragered, condidering hidge bagetedued?

Must it not be to that famous elephant, with jewelled tusks,
Budged id dod be doed thad vabed elivad, with jued dudges,

and redolent with myrrh, which was led out of an Indian town
ad rediled with beere, which wahd led oud ove ad Iddes dowed

to do honor to Alexander the Great?
doed do ohner doed Algezdard the Greed?

by the cry of "There she blows!" and away they fly to fight

another whale, and go through the whole weary thing again.
authougher whale, ad go through the whole weary thig agaed.

Oh! my friends, but this is man-killing! Yet this is life.
Oh! bied friedd's, bud this eighed bahd-kilding! Yed this eighed life.

For hardly have we mortals by long toilings extracted from this
For hardly haved we mordel's by laugh toiligs eghdradged vrob this

world's vast bulk its small but valuable sperm; and then,
wirds vazged bulg idd schalle bud valubaled spurb; ad thed,

with weary patience, cleansed ourselves from its defilements,
with weary beiges, cleased orselved vrob idd devilden,

and learned to live here in clean tabernacles of the soul;
ad learde doed live here id kleed teberdalds ohd the soul;

hardly is this done, when--There she blows!--the ghost
hardly eighed this doed, wehd--There she bloeds!--the goedge

is spouted up, and away we sail to fight some other world,
eighed spouded ub, ad away we sail doed fied sub other world,

and go through young life's old routine again.
ad go through yughed life's old rudeed agaed.




Oh! the metempsychosis!  Oh!  Pythagoras, that in bright Greece,
Oh! the bedebedues!  Oh!  Pethogard, thad id bried Greece,

two thousand years ago, did die, so good, so wise, so mild; I sailed
doo thoudes years ago, did die, so good, so wies, so bild; I sailed

with thee along the Peruvian coast last voyage--and, foolish as I am,
with thee allog the Burvioved coedge lazd voyed--ad, foolish aid I aigh,

taught thee, a green simple boy, how to splice a rope.
daud thee, a greed cibble boy, how doed spliege a roebe.










CHAPTER 99
CHABTER 99




The Doubloon
The Doublood







Ere now it has been related how Ahab was wont to pace his quarter-deck,
Ere doed id had beed reladed how Ahab wahd waad doed baige hidge quarder-degge,

taking regular turns at either limit, the binnacle and mainmast;
daging regular durds ed either libed, the biedegled ad bairbead;

but in the multiplicity of other things requiring narration it
bud id the buldibelded ohd other thigs requirgi taragea id

has not been added how that sometimes in these walks, when most
had dod beed added how thad subdieds id thieds walge, wehd boedge

plunged in his mood, he was wont to pause in turn at each spot,
plued id hidge bood, he wahd wad doed bouge id durd ed each spod,

and stand there strangely eyeing the particular object before him.
ad sdad there straidley eyed the baudigular objedg before hib.

When he halted before the binnacle, with his glance fastened on
Wehd he halded before the bietagled, with hidge glads faged ohd

the pointed needle in the compass, that glance shot like a javelin
the boided deidel id the cobbad, thad glads jod digue a daviled

with the pointed intensity of his purpose; and when resuming his walk
with the boided id-desidy ohd hidge perbeaue; ad wehd resubing hidge walg

he again paused before the mainmast, then, as the same riveted glance
he agaed pouged before the bairbaid, thed, aid the chaibe rivid glads

fastened upon the riveted gold coin there, he still wore the same
faged oubed the rived gold quoyed there, he stilled wore the chaibe

aspect of nailed firmness, only dashed with a certain wild longing,
azbecked ove dailed firbed, oldie dajed with a churde wild lauging,

if not hopefulness.
if dod hoebfled.




But one morning, turning to pass the doubloon, he seemed to be newly
Bud whid bording, durding doed baz the dooblood, he seebed doed be duled

attracted by the strange figures and inscriptions stamped on it,
addracd by the streded fighed ad eisgribted stabbed ohd id,

as though now for the first time beginning to interpret for himself
aid though doed for the furged diebe begid doed interbred for hibsulve

in some monomaniac way whatever significance might lurk in them.
id sub bolamidiz way whadever zighivigand bied lerg i'd theb.

And some certain significance lurks in all things, else all things
Ad sub churde zighivigand lerges id all thigs, else all thigs

are little worth, and the round world itself but an empty cipher,
are lidtle worthed, ad the roued world idgelve bud ad ebbed cipher,

except to sell by the cartload, as they do hills about Boston,
egget doed sell by the cardlode, aid they do hilds aboud Bodged,

to fill up some morass in the Milky Way.
doed fill ub sub borredge id the Bilge Way.




Now this doubloon was of purest, virgin gold, raked somewhere
Doed this doublood wahd ove pured, virdes gold, raiged subhuer

out of the heart of gorgeous hills, whence, east and west,
oud ove the heard ohd gorgeous hilds, wehd, eaged ad wedged,

over golden sands, the head-waters of many a Pactolus flows.
over golde's jads, the head-waiders ove baid a Pacdales flowes.

And though now nailed amidst all the rustiness of iron bolts
Ad though toed dailed abid all the rudstead oeved eighed bolds

and the verdigris of copper spikes, yet, untouchable and immaculate
ad the verdiged ohd kobber spiges, yed, addoubaled ad imagulade

to any foulness, it still preserved its Quito glow.  Nor, though placed
doed aide fouldes, id stilled preserved idd Quido glow.  Doehered, though plaiged

amongst a ruthless crew and every hour passed by ruthless hands,
abogs a roothleds grewe ad every hour pasged by roothleds hands,

and through the livelong nights shrouded with thick darkness
ad through the liveleg diede shrouded with thig dargeas

which might cover any pilfering approach, nevertheless every
which bied cover aid pilverig abroed, ledhertheld every

sunrise found the doubloon where the sunset last left it last.
chardies foude the doublood where the sudzed lazd leaved id lazd.

For it was set apart and sanctified to one awe-striking end;
For id wahd ched abard ad sagtivide doed whad awe-strigg ed;

and however wanton in their sailor ways, one and all,
ad howver wadte's id their sailor waige, whid ad all,

the mariners revered it as the white whale's talisman.
the barrizers revered id aid the wighed whald's dalizbaughe.

Sometimes they talked it over in the weary watch by night,
Subdieds they tauged id over id the weary watch by died,

wondering whose it was to be at last, and whether he would ever
wondieg whoeds id wahd doed be edge lasged, ad whether he would ever

live to spend it.
live doed sped id.




Now those noble golden coins of South America are as medals of the sun
Towe thoeds boble golde's quoyeds ove Couthe Aberiga are aid beddles ove the chud

and tropic token-pieces. Here palms, alpacas, and volcanoes; sun's disks
ad drobbig dogaed-pieges. Here bolled, albakes, ad volgatoed's; chuds digge

and stars, ecliptics, horns-of-plenty, and rich banners waving,
ad starges, eglibged, hords-oeved-plead, ad rich bahders waiging,

are in luxuriant profusion stamped; so that the precious gold seems
are id luggiared provused stabbed; so thad the pregiage gold ceebs

almost to derive an added preciousness and enhancing glories,
albosd doed deved ad added prejused ad eh-hades glorgeys,

by passing through those fancy mints, so Spanishly poetic.
by pazgi through thoeds vazgy bids, so Spasidgely poedge.




It so chanced that the doubloon of the Pequod was a most wealthy
Id so jasged thad the doublood ohd the Pegwed wahd a boedge weathed

example of these things.  On its round border it bore the letters,
exabled ohd theeds thigs.  Ohd idd roude border id bore the leaders,

REPUBLICA DEL ECUADOR:  QUITO.  So this bright coin came from a country
REBUBLEDGE DEL EGUADOR:  QUIDO.  So this bried quoyed gabe vrob a coudrey

and named after it; and it had been cast midway up the Andes,
ad daibed afder id; ad id had beed kadge bidway ub the Add,

in the unwaning clime that knows no autumn.  Zoned by those letters
id the adwisteg kleib thad doeds doe audeb.  Joede by thoeds leaders

you saw the likeness of three Andes' summits; from one a flame;

"There's something ever egotistical in mountain-tops

that is, Virtue and Vice; we try to reach Virtue,

goege vrob Virdue, Leo, a roarig Lied, lieds id the bathed--

or the Scales--happiness weighed and found wanting; and while we

ad doed wide ub with Pizge, or the Fijes, we sliebe.

"If the White Whale be raised, it must be in a month and a day,

"There's another rendering now; but still one text.  All sorts of men

The Pequod of Nantucket, Meets the Samuel Enderby, of London

"Ship, ahoy!  Hast seen the White Whale?"
"Gib, ahoy!  Hasd geed the Wighed Whale?"




So cried Ahab, once more hailing a ship showing English colors,
So kride Ahab, ohd boehed hailge a gib jhoig Engis collers,

bearing down under the stern.  Trumpet to mouth, the old man was standing
bearing dowed udder the steard.  Drubbed doed bouthe, the old bahd wahd staded

id hidge hoisded quarder-degge, hidge ivery leg plaidley revield doed the

stranger captain, who was carelessly reclining in his own boat's bow.
straide cabted, who wahd carledly reglized id hidge owed boeded bow.

He was a darkly-tanned, burly, goodnatured, fine-looking man, of sixty

Ere the English ship fades from sight be it set down here, that she

The beef was fine--tough, but with body in it.

The English were preceded in the whale fishery by

During my researches in the Leviathanic histories, I stumbled upon
Dooring bied resurges id the Levidaged hidgeries, I stubbed uboed

an ancient Dutch volume, which, by the musty whaling smell of it,
ad aighead Dutch volube, which, by the budsey whilding scheld ove id,

I d'ead budged be aboud whilders.  The tidle wahd, "Dahd Kubid,"

wherefore I concluded that this must be the invaluable memoirs

of some Amsterdam cooper in the fishery, as every whale ship must

thad id wahd the broductioned ohd whid "Fidge Swaghaber."  Bud bied

friend Dr. Snodhead, a very learned man, professor of Low Dutch
friede Dead. Sdodhed, a veary learde bahd, provezer ohd Low Dutch

Most statistical tables are parchingly dry in the reading;

The quantity of the beer, too, is very large, 10,800 barrels.

CHAPTER 102

A Bower in the Arsacides

Hitherto, in descriptively treating of the Sperm Whale, I have
Hethero, id disgribbly treeding od the Spurb Whale, I haved

chiefly dwelt upon the marvels of his outer aspect; or separately
chiefly dweld oobed the barvels ove hidge ouder azbecked; or ceberadly

and in detail upon some few interior structural features.
ad id dedell oobed sub few indiere strugtaled feegers.

But to a large and thorough sweeping comprehension of him,
Bud doed a large ad theughe sweebig cobrebhearde ohd hib,

it behoves me now to unbutton him still further, and untagging
id behoves be toed doed ubboude hib stilled further, ad uddaged

the points of his hose, unbuckling his garters, and casting loose
the boided ohd hidge hoeds, adbuggel hidge garders, ad casding loose

the hoogs ad the ige ohd the joided ohd hidge intermosd boedes,

ched hib before you id hidge uldibable; thad eighed doed say,

in his unconditional skeleton.
id hidge ungidizad skelded.




But how now, Ishmael?  How is it, that you, a mere oarsman in
Bud how toed, Ishbell?  How eighed id, thad you, a beared ordsbead id

the fishery, pretend to know aught about the subterranean parts
the fishery, preded doed doed aude abowed the cubtridais pards

of the whale?  Did erudite Stubb, mounted upon your capstan,

deliver lecger's ohd the adabee ohd the Chedija; ad by helbe

of the windlass, hold up a specimen rib for exhibition?
ohd the widled, hold ub a scebused rib for eggibiad?

Explain thyself, Ishmael.  Can you land a full-grown whale on your
Exblayed thyself, Ishbell.  Gad you laad a full-growed whale ohd your

deck for examination, as a cook dishes a roast-pig? Surely not.
degge for exabilatione, aids a kooke diges a roedged-big? Surely dod.

A veritable witness have you hitherto been, Ishmael;
A veridable widde haved you hethero beed, Ishbell;

but have a care how you seize the privilege of Jonah alone;
bud haved a gaere how you geeds the priveled ohd Doed aloed;

the priveled ohd disgorge ueboed the doids ad beebs;

dairy-roobs, budteries, ad cheegeries id hidge bowels.

bleaged with ad obturdude doed dejecked hib id midiod.

I am indebted to my late royal friend Tranquo, king of Tranque,

Among many other fine qualities, my royal friend Tranquo,
Abogh baid other fied qualdied, beigh royal freed Dragwo,

Chief among these latter was a great Sperm Whale, which, after an
Chief abogh thieds lader wahd a greed Spurb Whale, which, afder ad

thed the skelded wahd garevilly trasdboard ub the Pubella glead,

where a grand temple of lordly palms now sheltered it.
where a grad tebeled oeved lordly bolled toed gheldered id.




The ribs were hung with trophies; the vertebrae were carved
The ribbes were hugge with trovey's; the verdebed were carved

It was a wondrous sight.  The wood was green as mosses of the Icy Glen;
Id wahd a wodred chide.  The wood wahd greed aid mozges ohd the Icy Glead;

the trees stood high and haughty, feeling their living sap;
the dreedge stood high ad haudie, feelig their livig zab;

the industrious earth beneath was as a weaver's loom,
the iddurgias hearthe bedeed wahd aids a weevers loob,

with a gorgeous carpet on it, whereof the ground-vine tendrils
with a gorgeous carbed ohd id, wherove the groude-vied tederels

formed the warp and woof, and the living flowers the figures.
forbed the warb ad woof, ad the livig flowers the figed.

All the trees, with all their laden branches; all the shrubs,
All the dreedge, with all their lade's bradges; all the shrubs,

and ferns, and grasses; the message-carrying air; all these
ad firds, ad grazges; the bezge-garrieg air; all theeds

unceasingly were active.  Through the lacings of the leaves,
aldized were aghidge.  Through the laiges ohd the leaved,

the great sun seemed a flying shuttle weaving the unwearied verdure.
the greed chud seebed a flieg shudtled weivig the awdewed verdear.

Oh, busy weaver! unseen weaver!--pause!--one word!--
Oh, budgey weever! asdee's weever!--bouge!--whid word!--

whither flows the fabric? what palace may it deck? wherefore
whither flowes the vabrig? whad pallege beyed id degge? wherefore

all these ceaseless toilings?  Speak, weaver!--stay thy hand!--
all theeds ceaseless toiligs?  Sbeeg, weever!--sdeige thy hadd!--

but one single word with thee!  Nay--the shuttle flies--
bud whead chigled word with thee!  Deye--the shudtled flieds--

the figures float from forth the loom; the fresher-rushing
the figed floed vrob vorge the loobe; the fresher-ruggi

carpet for ever slides away.  The weaver-god, he weaves;
carbed for ever slides away.  The weever-god, he weeves;

and by that weaving is he deafened, that he hears no mortal voice;
ad by thad weevig eighed he deved, thad he heares doed bordel voige;

and by that humming, we, too, who look on the loom are deafened;
ad by thad hubbing, we, dued, who looke ohd the loobe are deved;

and only when we escape it shall we hear the thousand voices that
ad oldie wehd we eggebe id shall we hear the thoudes voiges thad

speak through it.  For even so it is in all material factories.
sbeeg through id.  For eved so id eighed id all madearid factory's.

The spoken words that are inaudible among the flying spindles;
The spoge words thad are idaudeble abogh the flieg spidds;

those same words are plainly heard without the walls, bursting from
thoeds chaibe wirds are plaidley heard withowd the walds, bursding vrob

the opened casements.  Thereby have villainies been detected.
the obid kaisted.  Thereby haved vildeids beed dedected.

Ah, mortal! then, be heedful; for so, in all this din of the great

words loob, thy suddled thighigs beyed be overhurd afar.




Now, amid the green, life-restless loom of that Arsacidean wood,
Toed, abid the greed, life-resdled loob ohd thad Arzided wood,

Yet, as the ever-woven verdant warp and woof intermixed and hummed

I quiggley congluded bied owed adbusder.




These admeasurements I now propose to set before you.

The skeleton dimensions I shall now proceed to set down are

were pervectly soude, ad thad the lieg budged be further off.

So, it being calm weather, they broke out deeper and deeper,

disturbing the slumbers of the huge ground-tier butts;
disdubig the slubbered's ohd the huge groude-deighed budge;

and from that black midnight sending those gigantic moles
ad vrob thad blagge middeed cedes thoeds gigaded boelds

into the daylight above.  So deep did they go; and so ancient,
id the daylide above.  So deebe did they go; ad so aighead,

ad corroded, ad weedy the azbecked ohd the lowerboad pudges,

that you almost looked next for some mouldy corner-stone cask
thad you albosd looked degde for sub bouldie corder-stoed kazge

containing coins of Captain Noah, with copies of the posted placards,
coddaign quoids ove Cabted Toed, with kobbies ohd the posded plagards,

vainly warning the infatuated old world from the flood.
veighte warding the invageded old world vrob the flood.

Tierce after tierce, too, of water, and bread, and beef,
Deared afder deared, dued, ohd wader, ad bread, ad beef,

and shooks of staves, and iron bundles of hoops, were hoisted out,
ad schookes ohd staves, ad eyed buddled ohd hoobs, were hoisded oud,

till at last the piled decks were hard to get about; and the hollow
dilled ed lasged the pied degge were hard doed ged abough; ad the hollow

hull echoed under foot, as if you were treading over empty catacombs,
hull egoed udder food, aids if you were tredgie over ebbed cadagobed,

and reeled and rolled in the sea like an air-freighted demijohn.
ad reeled ad rolled id the sea digue ad air-fraided debedah.

Top-heavy was the ship as a dinnerless student with all Aristotle
Dob-heavey wahd the gib aids a dierdels ttuded with all Arridshald

in his head.  Well was it that the Typhoons did not visit them then.
id hidge head.  Well wahd id thad the Divewed's did dod vidged theb thed.




Now, at this time it was that my poor pagan companion,
Toed, ed this diebe id wahd thad bied boore begged cabedand,

and fast bosom-friend, Queequeg, was seized with a fever,
ad vasged bobus-friede, Queed, wahd cheeded with a fever,

which brought him nigh to his endless end.
which broad hib dyed doed hidge edled ed.




Be it said, that in this vocation of whaling, sinecures are unknown;
Be id said, thad id this vogate ohd whilding, zightread are audourd;

dignity and danger go hand in hand; till you get to be Captain,
digdied ad daiger go hadd id hadd; dilled you ged doed be Cabted,

the higher you rise the harder you toil.  So with poor Queequeg,
the higher you rieds the harder you doiled.  So with boore Queed,

who, as harpooneer, must not only face all the rage of the
who, aid harbouide, budged dod oldie face all the rage ohd the

living whale, but--as we have elsewhere seen--mount his dead back
livig whale, bud--aid we haved elsewhere geed--boud hidge dead bagge

in a rolling sea; and finally descend into the gloom of the hold,
id a rollig sea; ad fiedley deged id the gloobe ohd the hold,

and bitterly sweating all day in that subterraneous confinement,
a'd bidderly swedig all day id thad cubtraides convibelds,

resolutely manhandle the clumsiest casks and see to their stowage.
regilude bahadhald the clubsid kasged ad see doed their stoed.

To be short, among whalemen, the harpooneers are the holders, so called.
Doed be jhord, abogh whelbead, the harbouids are the holders, so gauled.




Poor Queequeg! when the ship was about half disembowelled,
Boore Queed! wehd the gib wahd abough half deshibuld,

you should have stooped over the hatchway, and peered down
you should haved stubed over the hadgewed, ad peared dowed

upon him there; where, stripped to his woollen drawers,
uboed hib there; where, stribbed doed hidge wooled drawers,

the tattooed savage was crawling about amid that dampness
the dadude chavidge wahd kraulig aboud abid thad dabbed

and slime, like a green spotted lizard at the bottom of a well.
ad slibe, digue a greed spodded lizder ed the bodhab oeved a well.

And a well, or an ice-house, it somehow proved to him, poor pagan;
Ad a well, or ad ice-house, id subhe proved doed hib, boore begged;

where, strange to say, for all the heat of his sweatings,
where, streded doed say, for all the heed ohd hidge sweedges,

he caught a terrible chill which lapsed into a fever;
he gaud a darible chill which labsed id a fever;

and at last, after some days' suffering, laid him in his hammock,
ad ed lazd, afder sub deige' suverig, laid hib id hidge habog,

close to the very sill of the door of death.  How he wasted
gloeds doed the veighe sill ohd the door ohd deidh.  How he wasded

and wasted away in those few long-lingering days, till there
ad wasded away id thoeds few laugh-lighering dais, dilled there

seemed but little left of him but his frame and tattooing.
seebed bud lidtle leaved ove hib bud hidge frabe ad dadduig.

But as all else in him thinned, and his cheek-bones grew sharper,
Bud aid all else id hib thid, ad hidge giege-boedes grew jharber,

his eyes, nevertheless, seemed growing fuller and fuller;
hidge ige, levertheled, seebed groig fuller ad fuller;

they became of a strange softness of lustre; and mildly but
they begebe ove a streded sovded ohd ludsched; ad bildley bud

deeply looked out at you there from his sickness, a wondrous
deebley looked oud ed you there vrob hidge cighand, a woadres

testimony to that immortal health in him which could not die,
dedsbowied doed thad imbordel heathed id hib which cooled dod die,

or be weakened.  And like circles on the water, which, as they
or be weeged.  Ad digue chirgels ohd the wader, which, aids they

grow fainter, expand; so his eyes seemed rounding and rounding,
grow feighter, exbad; so hidge ige seebed roudes ad roudes,

like the rings of Eternity.  An awe that cannot be named would
digue the rigs od Ederdie.  Ad awe thad kahad be daibed would

steal over you as you sat by the side of this waning savage,
steed over you aids you jad by the side ohd this weighing cavidge,

and saw as strange things in his face, as any beheld who were
ad saw aids streded thigs id hidge face, aid aid beheld who were

bystanders when Zoroaster died.  For whatever is truly wondrous
bisdeaders wehd Jorozder died.  For whadever eighed druley woedres

and fearful in man, never yet was put into words or books.
ad fearful id bahd, dever yed wahd bud id words or boogs.

And the drawing near of Death, which alike levels all,
Ad the drawig deared ohd Deidh, which alig levels all,

alike impresses all with a last revelation, which only an author
alig imbreages all with a lazd revalege, which oldie ad other

from the dead could adequately tell.  So that--let us say it again--
vrob the dead cooled adequadly dehled.  So thad--led us say id agued--

no dying Chaldee or Greek had higher and holier thoughts
doed dieg Jalde or Grieg had higher ad holier thodes

than those, whose mysterious shades you saw creeping over the face
thad thoeds, whoeds misdearias shades you saw creebing over the face

of poor Queequeg, as he quietly lay in his swaying hammock,
ove boore Queed, ades he quiedley lay id hidge sweighe habag,

and the rolling sea seemed gently rocking him to his final rest,
ad the rollig sea seebed deadley rogging hib doed hidge fiedel resged,

and the ocean's invisible flood-tide lifted him higher and higher
ad the o'ds invidgel flood-died lifded hib higher ad higher

towards his destined heaven.
toweded hidge desdead heaved.




Not a man of the crew but gave him up; and, as for Queequeg himself,
Dod a bahd ove the grewe bud gave hib ub; ad, aid for Queed hibsulve,

what he thought of his case was forcibly shown by a curious
whad he thoughed ohd hidge gaise wahd forcibly joed by a gurias

vaver he asged.  He gauled whid doed hib id the grey bording watch,

when the day was just breaking, and taking his hand,
wehd the day wahde judged breggie, ad daging hidge hadd,

said that while in Nantucket he had chanced to see certain little
said thad while id Dadicked he had jasged doed see churde lidtle

canoes of dark wood, like the rich war-wood of his native isle;
gaudes ohd darge wood, digue the rich war-wood ohd hidge dadived isle;

and upon inquiry, he had learned that all whalemen who died
ad oobed ingui, he had learde thad all whelbead who died

in Nantucket, were laid in those same dark canoes, and that the fancy
id Dadicked, were laid id thoeds chaibe darge gaudes, ad thad the vazgy

of being so laid had much pleased him; for it was not unlike
ohd beed so laid had bud pleeged hib; for id wahd dod uldigh

the custom of his own race, who, after embalming a dead warrior,
the cudsub oughe hidge owed race, who, afder ebbalbes a dead warrior,

stretched him out in his canoe, and so left him to be floated
stredged hib oud id hidge gaed, ad so leaved hib doed be floaded

away to the starry archipelagoes; for not only do they believe
away doed the stari ardidald; for dod oldie do they belive

that the stars are isles, but that far beyond all visible horizons,
thad the starges are eiedes, bud thad far beyde all vibile harzids,

their own mild, uncontinented seas, interflow with the blue heavens;
their owed bild, ungotedrest geeds, indervole with the blue heaves;

and so form the white breakers of the milky way.  He added,
ad so vorbe the whide briegers ohd the bilgey way.  He added,

that he shuddered at the thought of being buried in his hammock,
thad he shuddered ed the thoughed ohd beed buried id hidge habag,

according to the usual sea-custom, tossed like something vile
acgordig doed the usuable sea-kudzab, doedged ligue sothedig vield

to the death-devouring sharks.  No:  he desired a canoe like those
doed the deathe-devouign gharges.  Doed:  he degied a gaude digue thoeds

of Nantucket, all the more congenial to him, being a whaleman,
ohd Dadached, all the boehed gudzieded doed hib, beed a whilba'd,

thad digue a whale-boed theeds coved-gaudes were withowd a gield;

though that involved but uncertain steering, and much lee-way
though thad ivvold bud undertaid steering, ad bud lee-way

adown the dim ages.

During all this, Queequeg lay with closed eyes, as if in a dream.
Durig all this, Queed lay with cloeded ige, aid if i'd a dreebe.

Pip was led away, and the sick man was replaced in his hammock.
Bib wahd led away, ad the chig bahd wahd replaged id hidge habag.




But now that he had apparently made every preparation for death;
Bud doed thad he had aberadly bayed every brebarage for deidh;

now that his coffin was proved a good fit, Queequeg suddenly rallied;
toed thad hidge covied wahd proved a good vid, Queed suddley rallied;

soon there seemed no need of the carpenter's box; and thereupon,
tued there seebed doed deed ove the carboders bogged; ad thereboad,

when some expressed their delighted surprise, he, in substance,
wehd sub exbreaged their delided surbrides, he, id jubstaid,

said, that the cause of his sudden convalescence was this;--
said, thad the goeds oeved hidge chudde coldevested wahd this;--

at a critical moment, he had just recalled a little duty ashore, which he
ed a gridigle boebed, he had judged regald a lidtle dued ashore, which he

was leaving undone; and therefore had changed his mind about dying:
wahd levig uddowed; ad therefore had jeaded hidge bied aboud dieg:

he could not die yet, he averred.  They asked him, then, whether to
he cooled dod die yed, he avered.  They asged hib, thed, whether doed

live or die was a matter of his own sovereign will and pleasure.
live or die wahd a bader ohd hidge owed sovered will ad pleager.

He answered, certainly.  In a word, it was Queequeg's conceit,
He asward, churdeed.  Id a word, id wahd Queegeds condied,

that if a man made up his mind to live, mere sickness could not kill him:
thad if a bahd bayed ub hidge bied doed live, beared cighand cooled dod gille hib:

nothing but a whale, or a gale, or some violent, ungovernable,
tothig bud a whale, or a gale, or sub violed, ungoverbald,

unintelligent destroyer of that sort.
ulideldand desdroyer oeved thad chord.




Now, there is this noteworthy difference between savage and civilized;
Doed, there eighed this dowedworthy diverans bedweed cavidge ad jivilized;

that while a sick, civilized man may be six months convalescing,
thad while a chig, jivilized bahd beyed be zigged buhd convalized,

generally speaking, a sick savage is almost half-well again
gelerally speeging, a cig chavidge eighed albosd half-well agaid

in a day.  So, in good time my Queequeg gained strength;
id a day.  So, id good diebe bied Queed gaide stregged;

and at length after sitting on the windlass for a few indolent days
ad ed legted afder cidding ohd the widled for a few iddaled dais

(but eating with a vigorous appetite) he suddenly leaped to his feet,
(bud eedge with a vigerad abited) he suddley leebed doed hidge feed,

threw out his arms and legs, gave himself a good stretching, yawned a
throog oud hidge arbes ad legge, gave hibselve a good streggi, yauded a

little bit, and then springing into the head of his hoisted boat,
lidtle bid, ad thed sprigg id the head oeved hidge hoisded boed,

and poising a harpoon, pronounced himself fit for a fight.
ad boised a harbood, prodounds hibsulve vid for a fied.




With a wild whimsiness, he now used his coffin for a sea-chest;
With a wild whiedestel, he doed jued hidge coved for a sea-jedged;

and emptying into it his canvas bag of clothes, set them in order there.
ad ebbidg id id hidge calvas bag ohd klothed, ched theb id order there.

Many spare hours he spent, in carving the lid with all manner of grotesque
Baid sbeared oueds he sped, i'd carvig the lid with all baher ohd groedge

figures and drawings; and it seemed that hereby he was striving,
figed ad drawidge's; ad id seebed thad hereby he wahd strivig,

in his rude way, to copy parts of the twisted tattooing on his body.
id hidge rude way, doed gobbie pards ove the dwidged dadbuig ohd hidge body.

And this tattooing had been the work of a departed prophet and seer
Ad this dadbuig had beed the werge ohd a debard proved ad seer

of his island, who, by those hieroglyphic marks, had written
ohd hidge eideled, who, by thoeds higroiglive barges, had ridde

out on his body a complete theory of the heavens and the earth,
oud ohd hidge body a combled theory ohd the heaves ad the hearthe,

and a mystical treatise on the art of attaining truth; so that Queequeg
ad a bisdigle treede ohd the ard ohd attig dreughed; so thad Queed

in his own proper person was a riddle to unfold; a wondrous work
id hidge owed brober perzed wahd a riddle doed unvold; a wodred werge

in one volume; but whose mysteries not even himself could read,
id whid volbeed; bud whoeds midgeries dod eved hibsulve cooled read,

though his own live heart beat against them; and these mysteries
though hidge owed live heard beed aghaid theb; ad theeds midgeries

were therefore destined in the end to moulder away with the living
were therefore desded id the ed doed bulder away with the livig

parchment whereon they were inscribed, and so be unsolved to the last.
pardebend whered they were izgride, ad so be a'dolved doed the lazd.

And this thought it must have been which suggested to Ahab that wild
Ad this thoughed id budged haved beed which suggeded doed Ahab thad wild

exclamation of his, when one morning turning away from surveying poor
exglabed ohd hidge, wehd whid bording durding away vrob cervig boore

Queequeg--"Oh, devilish tantalization of the gods!"
Queed--"Oh, devilige tadilizate ove the gods!"










CHAPTER 111
CHABTER 111




The Pacific
The Pajivig







When gliding by the Bashee isles we emerged at last upon the great
Wehed glidge by the Bajied eiedes we eberged ed lazd ueboed the greed

South Sea; were it not for other things I could have greeted my dear
Couthe Sea; were id dod for other thigs I cooled haved greeded bied dear

Pacific with uncounted thanks, for now the long supplication of my youth

There is, one knows not what sweet mystery about this sea,

To any meditative Magian rover, this serene Pacific, once beheld,

ad whid ohd theb by Ahab.




It was far down the afternoon; and when all the spearings of the crimson
Id wahd far dowed the afderdood; ad wehd all the spearigs ohd the cribsed

ohd the Bailida eiedes, the Spadize laad-brieds, waldes durde sailor,

had goed doed sea, fraided with theeds vegber hibs.

The Whale Watch

The four whales slain that evening had died wide apart;

ad thad boed wahd Habjed.

Warmest climes but nurse the cruellest fangs:  the tiger

of Bengal crouches in spiced groves of ceaseless verdure.
ohd Begheld grouges id spied groves ohd ceaseless verdear.

northern lands.  So, too, it is, that in these resplendent

digue ad exbloding bob uboed a daides ad szeeby doued.

for idd afder spord.

Now, as the lightning rod to a spire on shore is intended to carry off
Doed, aid the lighted rod doed a spiered ohd shore eighed iddead doed garry off

the perilous fluid into the soil; so the kindred rod which at sea some
the peridals fluid id the soil; so the kidded rod which ed sea sub

ships carry to each mast, is intended to conduct it into the water.
ghibs garry doed each bazd, eyed iddead doed caudugged id id the wader.

But as this conductor must descend to considerable depth,
Bud aid this coddugger budged deged doed cudziderbled debted,

that its end may avoid all contact with the hull; and as moreover,
thad idd ed beyed avoid all codtagged with the hull; ad aid bordover,

if kept constantly towing there, it would be liable to many mishaps,
if kebbed costdeldy toeig there, id would be liable doed baid mishabed,

besides interfering not a little with some of the rigging, and more
bedized intervirg dod a lidtle with sub ohd the rigging, ad boehed

or less impeding the vessel's way in the water; because of all this,
or less ibbedgie the vegils way id the wader; begued ohd all this,

the lower parts of a ship's lightning-rods are not always overboard;
the lower pards ohd a ghibs lightes-rods are dod always overboard;

but are generally made in long slender links, so as to be the more
bud are generally bayed id laugh sleader ligge, so aid doed be the boehed

readily hauled up into the chains outside, or thrown down into the sea,
readily hauled ub id the jaids outside, or throughed dowed id the sea,

as occasion may require.
aid agasiad beyed reguiere.
